loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thúy works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Angela Yaneth

texts.es:
Ángela es una joven de 25 años de edad muy trabajadora que estudió hasta el bachillerato, debido a su  situación económica no pudo continuar con sus estudios pero ella siempre ha querido seguir estudiando en la universidad, actualmente está acompañada desde hace 7 años, su esposo es motorista trabaja con un camión halando mercaderías y materiales, ellos tienen un hijo de 5 años el cual estudia en la escuela.

 Ángela se dedica al comercio vendiendo frutas y verduras en el mercado, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años comenta que se decidió por este trabajo debido a que quería aportar a su casa, además de esta actividad ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar frutas, verduras, arroz, frijoles, aceites, entres otros productos y así tener surtida su tienda.

Sus planes son ampliar su negocio, ayudar a su hijo en los estudios para que pueda desarrollarse mejor en un futuro y también nunca descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Angela is a 25-year-old young woman. She is very hard-working, and she studied through high school. As a result of her economic situation, she was unable to continue with her education. However, she has always wanted to continue her studies in college. She has been married for the past 7 years. Her husband is a driver, and he works pulling goods and materials with a truck. They have a 5-year-old son, who is in school. 

Angela makes a living as a merchant, selling fruits and vegetables in the market. She has been performing this work for the past 3 years, and she states that she decided to start this business because she wanted to contribute to her family. In addition to this job, she performs household chores.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruits, vegetables, rice, beans, and oil, among other products, in order to stock her store. She plans to expand her business and to help her son with his studies so that he can have better opportunities in the future. Additionally, she never dismisses the possibility of continuing her education by pursuing a college career.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, rice, beans, and oil, among other products, in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 1 hijo y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlo adelante.

Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos, adicional a esto trabaja en producción y venta de comidas que ella misma prepara en su casa. 
Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras, además desea comprar insumos para su producción de alimentos.
Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante
texts.en:
Ana is a very experienced, wise woman with great patience. She is a mother of one and has worked practically her entire life to get ahead. 

She has a small stand from which she smells fried goods, sweets and drinks. She also makes and sells food that she prepares at home. She works every day from 5:00 am until 3:00 pm to have her product ready and fresh for her clients, which for the most part are neighbors who live in the sector where she lives.

She wants to capitalize on her business and receive a large advance on her supplies and inventory of products. Due to this, she turns to a loan to buy a stock of drinks and fried goods, as well as buy supplies for her prepared food. 

One of her biggest difficulties is the lack of money to invest in her business, but she trusts in the help of Corporación Interactuar and the goodwill of the lenders at Kiva to help her get ahead.

loans.use: buy a variety of drinks and fried goods as well as buy supplies for her foodsales

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Leonila has been in this business for two years. Leonila earns more income from food vending and gasoline retailing.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 36 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nairobi

texts.es:
Nairobi es un estudiante de Odontologia,ella solicita un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios y esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Nairobi tengo 21 de edad soy la mayor de 3 hermanos nací en Los Botados y vivo en yamasá provincia Monte Plata soy una persona humilde y responsable me gusta leer y pensar bien las cosas ante de actuar. Mi madre trabaja en una casa de familia y mi padre en una panadería. 
Quiero estudiar Odontología en la Universidad Odontológica Dominicana ya que es mi vocación ser odontóloga, pero no una más del montón sino marcar la diferencia siendo una muy buena odontóloga.    
Necesito este préstamo porque soy una persona de bajos recursos y de no obtener este préstamo me vería en la obligación de no cursar mi carrera por lo que estoy segura que si me otorgan este préstamo mi vida cambiaria mucho porque tendré la oportunidad de estudiar mi carrera.
Mis metas son ser una estudiante estrella y ser una excelente odontóloga, trabajar en una clínica odontológica o en un hospital  y después poner mi propio consultorio para brindar ayuda a las personas de bajos recursos con su salud bucal, ya que hay muchas personas que no pueden llevar un tratamiento bucal porque son muy costosos.
texts.en:
Nairobi is a dental student. She asks for the loan to pay for her studies and this is her story:

My name is Nairobi and I am 21 years old. I was born in Los Botados and am the oldest of three siblings. I live in Yamasá in the province of Monte Plata. 

I am a humble and responsible person who likes to read and reflect on things before acting. 
My mother works taking care of a family’s home and my father works in a bakery. 

I want to study dentistry at the Universidad Odontológica Dominicana, as it is my calling to be a dentist. I don’t want to just be one of the many already out there, but rather I will make a difference as a great dentist. 

I need this loan because I am a person of not many means. Not having this loan means I won’t be able to pursue my career. I am certain that if I ask for this loan, my life will change for the better because I will have the opportunity to study dentistry. 

My goals are to be a star student and an excellent dentist. I want to work in a dental clinic or in a hospital and afterwards open my own office to help those in need. There are many people who can’t afford dental care, as it is very expensive.

loans.use: to cover university costs

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Ermelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ermelinda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Ermelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Azela

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Azela works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and a general store. Azela is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Azela has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lileth Yuliana

texts.es:
Lileth es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Lileth y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Lileth is a very entrepreneurial woman who desires to move forward and make progress. For the last two years, she has made a living selling products from catalogs such as clothing, beauty products, and household items. She sells mainly to her friends, neighbors, and family members who know her and want her to get ahead through her business. 

Since she was a little girl, Lileth has had a knack for business and sales. Today she has shown great ability in this area thanks to her friendliness and the excellent quality of her service. 

Lileth is requesting this loan in order to buy her stock of beauty products and clothing to increase her inventory and increase her sales. This will help her improve her earning for her household.

Lileth holds hope of getting ahead thanks to the support of people with good hearts who support these types of projects and the support of Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy a supply of beauty products and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marlinda

texts.en:
Marlinda is 43 years old and married with three children. 

Marlinda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marlinda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her livestock. Marlinda has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her livestock

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Medeline

texts.en:

Medeline has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from pig fattening. Medeline aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, detergent soap, cereals, coffee, sugar, shampoo, and fabric conditioners

Genoveva has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Rona Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like umbrellas, blouses, slippers, etc., to sell

She has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, etc. 

Charlyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Jhanlou requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Jhanlou has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leidy Carolina

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de útiles escolares para vender en esta temporada.

Es una madre soltera muy emprendedora y luchadora.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de útiles escolares para poder iniciar con este negocio.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su hija de 15 meses todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus gastos y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una joven emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Leidy is a woman with all the energy and willingness to face the world and succeed. She wishes to start a business selling school supplies this season. She is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working single mother. 

She is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of school supplies so that she can start her business. With this loan, she will be able to fulfill her dream of being independent and giving her 15-month-old daughter everything she needs. In addition, she will be able to cover her expenses and move forward thanks to this support from Kiva and Interactuar

Support the project of an entrepreneurial young Colombian woman!

loans.use: to buy an assortment of school supplies so that she can start her business.

loans.name: Duvan Albeiro

texts.es:
Duvan es padre de un hijo de 5 años de edad; desde hace aproximadamente 2 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, almohadas, cojines, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor de su surtido así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada; mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Duvan, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Duvan is a father of a 5 year-old boy. He has worked as an independent businessman for approximately the last two years, a business he learned empirically out of the necessity to generate income to provide for his family. He offers all kinds of products such as clothes, pillows, and cushions among others. He counts on the advantage that meets new people daily to whom he can offer his merchandise, improving his sales each day.

He asks for this loan to buy merchandise for his overhead so that he can stock greater variety to satisfy the increasing demand of this season and thereby increase his income. 

Duvan with determination and dedication, wants to keep working to grow his business. 
His dream for the near future is to open a grocery store in a commercial zone where he can offer a variety of goods. This will allow him the profitability and economic stability to give his son an excellent education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pillows, clothes, cushions, among other things for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with University expenses (to pay for registration and the monthly payment for the new school year).

Marivic has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 54 years old and married with two children.

Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rose has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rose aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Michelle works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell household product business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Michelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her buy and sell household product business.

Michelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food and ready to wear vending. Lolita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers for her direct selling Avon products business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Mamerta works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mamerta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

Mamerta has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yeimy Eliced

texts.es:
Yeimy, a sus 27años de edad, es madre de tres hijos de 5, 9 y 10 años. 
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, esto la llevó a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio, una venta de mercancía.

Por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de ropa, lociones, accesorios para iniciar con la venta de los mismos en el municipio de Puerto Salgar, de esta manera dará inicio a su idea de negocio, aprovechando la buena ubicación del sector donde pondrá su negocio, pues es una zona muy transitada y existe la posibilidad de atraer muchos clientes potenciales. 

De esta forma, Yeimy espera poder recibir los recursos necesarios para salir adelante al lado de su familia y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación, además esto servirá como impulso para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es montar un negocio en un local bien acreditado, que le genere buenos ingresos para mejorar a mediano plazo, sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yeimy, at her 27 years of age, is the mother of three children.  They are 5-, 9- and 10-years old respectively.
 
Due to a lack of work opportunities, Yeimy went through a difficult financial situation.  This lead her to look for options to get ahead, and she wants to start her own business selling merchandise.  That is what motivated to request a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of clothing, lotions and accessories.  She will start selling her merchandise in Puerto Salgar, putting her business idea into action and taking advantage of a good location in the area that is very well-traveled and offers the possibility of attracting a lot of potential customers. 

Yeimy hopes to receive the necessary resources to help her get ahead alongside her family and to be able to offer her children a better education.  In addition, this loan will serve as the impulse to advance Yeimy toward realizing her main dream, which is to start a business in a well-known storefront.  This would generate a good income so as to improve, in a moderate amount of time, her own standard of living as well as her children's.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, lotions and accessories to start her retail business.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder es un hombre de 30 años de edad padre de un hijo de 3 años.

Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por como ropa, calzado y accesorios; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su familia. 

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía (ropa, perfumería, accesorios, lencería) con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Wilder is a 30 year old father of a three year old son. 

He currently makes a living selling merchandise such as clothing, footwear and accessories. 
He began this business thanks to the help of a family member, which has helped him receive income to support his family. 

He is a hard working and strong person, who desires to get ahead by growing his business. 

He wants to use the loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy merchandise (clothing, perfume, accessories, lingerie). By offering a greater variety of products to satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of his clients, the majority of whom are friends and neighbors, he can increase his sales. 

His main goal is to have a large quantity of overhead stock, fill his wallet with good clients and increase his sales so that he can have a better well-being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes, perfume, accessories, lingerie)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia owns cows, sheep and poultry. She dedicates herself to selling her cows' milk and cultivates corn and kidney beans on a field close to her house. She decided to purchase a biodigester in order to reduce her operating costs and have more money available to expand her farm. Indeed, she used to buy expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers while she was cooking with wood she collected in the surroundings. At the same time, she piled up her animals' waste outside the farm, where it was emitting greenhouse gases and contaminating underground water sources. 

Her biodigester will allow Cecilia to treat her animals' manure, produce renewable energy (biogas) to cook and heat water in the house, while also generating nutrient-rich organic fertilizer to increase the yield of her field in a sustainable way. As she displaces fossil fuels from her farm's operations and eliminates the toxic smoke of burning wood from her house, her and her family's quality of life will drastically improve. Cecilia plans to invest her savings in buying additional cows to increase her milk production and generate additional income for the household.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано  умная женщина, она работает в медицинском .  У нее неплохой заработок но все же на необходимые условия недостаточны что осуществить все свои мечты.  У нее 3 прекрасных детей и любящий муж. Ее муж также вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет.  У Рано большие планы и надежды, но для всего этого нужны средства.  Для этого она хочет получить кредит что бы  оплатить за обучение в университете сына. Она мечтает что бы ее дети получили хорошее образование и достойную работу. Так как сама Рано является медиком и хочет что бы ее дети имели высшее образование в лучших университетах.
texts.en: Rano is a very smart woman and a medical professional.   She makes a rather good income; however her earnings are still insufficient to give her the possibility of achieving her dreams.  She is the mother of three beautiful children and she has a devoted husband.  Her husband also contributes to the budget of the family.  Rano has big projects and hopes, but all these require money.  For this reason, she is taking a loan which will help her to pay her son's university tuition.  She is dreaming of giving a good education to her children, so that they can have good jobs.  Since she is herself a physician, she wants her children to get a higher education in the best universities.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: José Rosa

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, debido a las condiciones económicas de sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos y todos se encuentran estudiando.


José se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, desde que tenía 14 años junto a sus padres trabaja en este rubro, con la experiencia que adquirió decidió seguir con esta actividad ya que no ha tenido otra fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia. El lugar donde trabaja está en el mismo terreno donde vive, sus hijos y su esposa se involucran y trabajan de 6:00 AM a 12:00 MD.

 
Él necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos como cuerdas, insecticidas,  fertilizantes, foliares, sulfato, etc. 


Sus sueños son que sus hijos se preparen académicamente, que sean profesionales, construir una vivienda más adecuada y también pretende ampliar el área donde cultiva para obtener mejores ganancias y tener siempre los productos disponibles para su comunidad.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old. He only attended school until the second grade due to the economic state of his parents. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. He has four children, all of which attend school. 


José makes a living growing vegetables. He started farming when he was 14 years old with his parents. With the experience he gained, he decided to continue this work as he didn’t have another source of income to support his family. The place he works is in the same plot in which he lives. He and his wife and kids help out and work from 6:00 am until 12:00 pm.

He needs the loan to buy supplies such as cords, insecticides, fertilizers, foliar fertilizers, sulfate, etc. 

He dreams that his children will prepare themselves academically and become professionals. He hopes that they will have a good life. He wants to increase the area where he grows to have greater income and always have products available for his community.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as cords, insecticides, fertilizers, foliar fertilizers, sulfate, etc.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло 27 лет. Она молодая жительница района Пяндж. Шахло занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью уже 4 года. Она имеет не большую часть земли, где она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Шахло готовится к посеву нового урожая и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет посадить люцерны. Шахло на заемные деньги решила  купить минеральные удобрение и семена люцерны. У нее не получилось собрать достаточную сумму денег для приобретения средств для посева и у нее все надежда остается на кредит. Вы можете поддержать Шахло.
texts.en: Shahlo is 27 years old and a young resident of the Pyandj district of Tajikistan.  She has been involved in agriculture for four years already.  She has a small plot of land on which she grows crops.  She is now ready to sow her land toward the next harvest, and for this reason, she is taking a loan.  She wants to sow alfalfa.  She will use her loan to buy mineral fertilizers as well as alfalfa's seeds.  She was not able to gather enough money to purchase what she needed to sow her land, so this loan is now her only hope.  Please support Shahlo.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and alfalfa's seeds.

loans.name: Duishobubu

texts.ru: Дуйшобубу, 61 год, замужем, мать 4 детей, они активно помогают по хозяйству. Образование у Дуйшобубу среднее, вместе с супругом они занимаются животноводством и полеводством уже 24 года. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 3 лошади и 30 овец, на 2,0 Га собственной земли Дуйшобубу выращивает пшеницу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации оптовым покупателям. Дуйшобубу решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. На прибыль от кредита Дуйшобубу планирует и дальше развивать ее деятельность, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Duishobubu is 61 years old, married, and the mother of four children who take an active part in the farm work.  Duishobubu has a secondary education.  She and her husband have been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 24 years.  By nature, Duishobubu is a very pleasant, caring, responsible and hardworking woman.  She has four cows, three horses and 30 sheep on her farm. On two hectares of her own land, she also grows wheat and clover for domestic consumption on the farm and for resale to wholesale buyers.  Duishobubu has decided to expand her farming business.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) which will help her to buy sheep and heifers and increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her activity, so that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and heifers in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 49 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for five years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en: Nerlita is 52 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Nerlita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Nerlita has been in the pig fattening business for three years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es un hombre emprendedor, estudioso y aplicado, desde hace 2 años comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 

El vive en el municipio de Itagüí con su madre a la cual manifiesta que tiene mucho que agradecerle en la vida.

El trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 5:00 Pm atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a granel como tomates, cebollas, papas, entre otros y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos is an enterprising, studious, and industrious man. He opened a vegetable shop 2 years ago, that has so far given very good results.

He lives in the city of Itagüí with his mother, and says that he has much to be thankful for in life.

He works Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm, serving a moderately high number of customers.

He requests a loan to buy bulk products, such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and others, and in this way satisfy the desires of the customers who ask for these products.

This assistance will to allow him to inject variety into his business, and will provide the juicy opportunity to improve his sales and household income

loans.use: to buy bulk products such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and others.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy, 31, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children. To support her family, she manages and operates a farming business. She grows rice and sells it to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this type of business for fifteen years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $5 a day. 

As a supplementary income, she has come up with a new business idea.  She wants to raise ducks for sale. However, her insufficient capital does not allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a KIVA loan to buy ducks. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her standard of living. 

She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy ducks.

loans.name: Mirabbos

texts.ru: Это Мираббос. Он житель района Спитамен. Ему всего 25 лет. Мираббос молодой муж и отец. Он ответственный человек. У Мираббос не было возможности поступить в университет. Он выбрал животноводческую деятельность, потому что его родители занимались той же деятельности. Ему научили, родители, как ухаживать за скотами и занимается бизнесом. У него есть коровник и корм для скота. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить скотов и начать бизнес. Мираббос хочет купить скотин и откармливать их несколько месяцев, потом вывозит на перепродажу. В будущем он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Мираббос очень нуждается на Вашу помощь. С вашей помощью он может приобрести скота и  зарабатывать на жизнь. Вы можете поддержать Мираббос.
texts.en: Meet Mirabbos, a resident of the Spitamen district of Tajikistan.  Mirabbos is only 25 years old, but already married and a father. He is a responsible man, but he did not get the opportunity to attend university.  He chose to become involved in animal husbandry because his parents were raising livestock and they showed him how to take care of farm animals and how to run a farming business.  Mirabbos has a stable stocked with cattle feed.  He is taking a loan to buy livestock and to start his own business.  He wants to buy some animals, fatten them for a few months, and then resell them.  In the future, he wants to increase the size of his herd and improve the living conditions of his family.  He is looking forward to your support.  Thanks to your help, he will be able to purchase livestock and make a living.  Please support Mirabbos.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start his own animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 44 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Magdalena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Magdalena has been farming rice for eleven years and also earns additional income from her general store and pig fattening business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arcon

texts.en: Arcon is 36 years old and married with five children.  With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Arcon has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, cooking oil, sugar and other groceries. In the future, Arcon would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary lives in a rural area located in the Samiki Meanchey district in Cambodia where rice farming is a common way to earn a living.  She is 47 years old and married with two children.  She and her husband have struggled to feed their two children by farming rice and raising pigs.  The current business earns her approximately 27,000 KHR per day. 

Sary has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles and she completely repaid the past loans.  Now she is applying for a loan to connect electric light for lightening in her home.  She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to connect electric light for lightening in her home.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Samaki Meanchey District

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina, 62, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalina has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalina has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc. 

Rosalina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is 56 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Magdalena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bottled water, canned goods, groceries, etc..

Ma. Magdalena has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Ma. Magdalena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bottled water, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.en:
Ramón produces corn on a large field, and sells the extra forage to other farmers in his community. He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to have more revenue available to start growing his hog farm, which has so far been limited by the important expenses in LP gas and chemical fertilizers. As he starts inputting his animals' manure in the biodigester, the natural methanisation process will transform it into bio-gas to cook and heat water in the house, while the bacteria will create nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer to increase the yield of Ramón's crops in a sustainable way. As he becomes more self-sufficient and eliminates fossil fuels from his farm, Ramón will protect the environment and have the financial capacity to buy additional hogs to expand his activity.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Aida has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Aida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё жительница города Худжанд. Ей 32 лет. Она замужем и мать одного ребенка. Муж Махайе находится за приделами страны на заработках. Ей трудно было обеспечить условия жизни ребенка. Она ждала, когда муж отправить ей деньги. Мухайе 2 года назад научилась кроить и шить женскую одежду. Ей научила ее сестра. Мухайе быстро освоила, чтобы скорее начать зарабатывать и улучшить финансовое состояние семьи. Ее нынешняя швейная машинка не выполняет свои функции хорошо. Она обратилась за кредитом, для купли новой швейной машинки. Это кредит поможет ей приобрести новую швейную машинку и сшить больше. Мухайё очень нужно Ваша помощь. Поддержите ее пожалуйста.
texts.en: Muhayo is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of a young child.  Her husband is currently working abroad.  Muhayo is finding it difficult to provide for her child, as she is still waiting to receive some money from her husband.  Two years ago, her sister taught her how to design and sew women's dresses.  Muhayo quickly mastered this craft, which has allowed her to start making some money and to improve the financial situation of her family.  However, her current sewing machine is no longer performing all its functions.  Muhayo is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine.  This loan will help her to make this purchase and to work faster.  Muhayo really needs your help.  Please support her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат 57 летняя жительница района Спитамен. У нее не большая семья. Муж и трое детей в возрасте 24, 21 и 18 лет. Мархамат 20 лет занимается выращиванием скота. Она ухаживает за животными у себя во дворе. Мархамат обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Мархамат ждет Вашу доброту. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Marhamat is 57 years old and she lives in the Spitamen district of Tajikistan.  She has a small family which consists of her husband and her three children who are now 24, 21 and 18 years old.  Marhamat has been raising livestock for 20 years.  She takes care of farm animals at home, on her farm.  She has applied for a loan because she currently only has a few animals left, and she needs to increase her livestock headcount in order to keep her activity.  Marhamat's animal husbandry activity is essential because it helps support her family.  Marhamat is awaiting your kindness.  She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to increase her cattle headcount and to keep her business.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Saturnina is 61 years old now.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Saturnina has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Apolonia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from clothing sales. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 49 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from boarding house rental.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Expedita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items  such as canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc. to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 55 years old and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sardines, snack food, and other groceries.

Beverly has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Beverly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, snack food, and other groceries.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Con su gran empuje y perseverancia, Hector ha salido adelante y ha podido educar y sostener a su familia conformada.

Siempre ha buscado la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, tanto así que ha pasado por numerosos trabajos en el municipio de Puerto Salgar.
Hoy en día, después de haber decidido por su independencia, trabaja en la fabricación de artículos y objetos artesanales en su talabartería.

Por esta y muchas más razones solicita un préstamo para compra materia prima como cuerda, cuero e insumos como agujas y pegas.

Con este préstamo podrá asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por ende de su familia.

Si prestas a este crédito estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
With his energy and perseverance, Hector has gotten ahead and has been able to educate and support his family. He is always looking for ways to earn more money for his family; he has taken many different jobs throughout his town of Puerto Sagar.

Now, having gained more independence, he is working in the manufacturing of handicraft items in his workshop. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy raw materials such as rope and leather, as well as supplies such as needles and paste. With this loan, he can ensure the sustainability of both his business and family. If you support this loan, you will be supporting the progress of Colombia!

loans.use: to buy raw material, such as rope and leather, and supplies such as needles and paste.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom attend school.

Florencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Florencia has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Florencia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia cuenta con una experiencia de 20 años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 7 años. 

Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades. 

Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos. 
Prefiere trabajar sola durante 9 horas aproximadamente todos los días.

Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Claudia requiere de un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio e insumos de confeccion como tela e hilos.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia has 20 years of experience in the sewing business; she has had her third-party sewing shop in her house for seven years. 

She works all day long and, with her shop, she wants to generate employment for people who really need it.

She learned this business from her mother, who taught her when she was very young.  The advantage is that she is well known in the area and the quality of her work is very high, which has allowed to her to keep gaining more customers for her business and which has also translated into good orders. 

She prefers to work on her own for about nine hours every day.  

Because her current production capacity is not enough to serve all of her customers, Claudia needs a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine to increase the production capacity of her business and to buy sewing supplies, such as fabric and thread.

Her greatest dream is to get ahead with her sewing shop and be able to have better financial opportunities at home to improve herself, along with her husband and their four children.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and sewing supplies, such as fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove for making pupusas and to invest in setting up a small store.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
Leopoldo de 59 años de edad, no estudió debido a la situación económica de su familia, está casado y su esposa  se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  tiene un hijo que tiene 14 años y estudia  8vo grado en la escuela. 


Leopoldo es jornalero, él siembra maíz y frijol, lo aprendió de sus padres que realizaban esta actividad, el lugar donde él trabaja está a 20 minutos y se va a pie, y lo hace de 6:00 AM a 12:00 MD.

 
El crédito lo solicita para pagar alquiler del terreno donde cultiva y la mano de obra.

Su sueño es construir una nueva vivienda en la cual pueda vivir cómodamente con su familia,  quiere apoyar a su hijo para que él sea el responsable de su hogar cuando sea grande.
texts.en:
Leopoldo, who is 59 years old, did not go to school because of his family's financial situation.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker; he has a son who is 14 and is in the eighth grade. 

Leopoldo is a laborer; he plants corn and beans; he learned to do this from his parents, who did this work.  The place where he works is 20 minutes away and he gets there on foot and works from 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM.

He is requesting this loan to pay the rent for the land where he plants and to pay for labor.  
 
His dream is to build a new home where he can live comfortably with his family; he wants to support his son so he can be the head of the household when he is grown.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the land where he plants and to pay for labor

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Living in a rural village of the Stoung district, Heng is aged 53 years and widowed. The main sources of the family’s income are from rice which she has been farming for 22 years to make a living. Heng has been with VisionFund for seven cycles already. She completely repaid the previous loans. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy purlins, sheet metal, cinder blocks, rebar, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Gabriel Jose

texts.es:
Gabriel es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos de papelería como útiles escolares, elementos para decoración, entre otros. 

Inicio el negocio hace 2 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.
El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospero. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como juguetería y cosméticos.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a man who is charged up and ready to face the world, and lead a full life thanks to his efforts.

He has a store where he sells stationery products, such as school supplies, decorations, among others.

He started the business 2 years ago, and despite its short time in operation, it has been well received in the sector.

He wants to expand his product offerings and to improve his sales, by injecting capital into his business. He is therefore requesting a loan, to be given the opportunity to be more prosperous.

The money will be invested in the purchase of goods that he does not currently have, such as toys and cosmetics.

He has high hopes for his business, and thinks his future can be significantly improved through the support of organizations like Interactuar, that make it possible for people to dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: to buy toys and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cleofas

texts.en:
Cleofas is 57 years old, married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Cleofas requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cleofas has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 27 years old and married with two children, both of whom attend school. Fatima works very hard to provide for them.

Fatima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, eggs and groceries. Fatima has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, eggs and groceries

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
Hy, 42, is from a rural village located in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province. She is married with one kid. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice and working as a garment worker. She and her husband have been in this business for five years. The current business earns her family about 30,000 KHR per day.
This is the seventh microloan for Hy with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun is 53 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a rural area located in the Phnom Srouch district, Cambodia. To make a living, he has been farming rice for ten years while his wife has been working as garment worker. The current business earns his family about 25,000 KHR per day.
Chun has been with VisionFund for eleven loan cycles. He completely repaid the past loans which have helped him to better support his family. He is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, gallinas y cuyes en la parte posterior de su domicilio, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 59 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Cayaltí District. The people here work in farming, trading, and raising livestock. The district is located in the Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque Region, on the northern Coast of Peru. 

Benjamín raises and sells small animals, such as  turkeys, chickens and guinea pigs, in the back of his house. His wife helps him with this labor. He has experience in this business, and very good personal and work references in the area. He requests this loan to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals. In this way, he can have better production to offer his customers, which will generate revenue and enable him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for fattening his animals.

loans.name: Jonna Lynn

texts.en:
Jonna Lynn is 30 years old. Jonna Lynn is married and has three children who are in school.

Jonna Lynn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jonna Lynn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonna Lynn has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jonna Lynn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 34-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her business.

Lorna has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and has a milk distribution business in the Philippines.

Salvacion requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of milk to sell to her customers.

Salvacion has been in this business for 10 years now.

Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of milk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a livestock raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosita is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her livestock raising business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Erlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Erlyn is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to  buy additional stocks like canned goods, rice, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, cooking oil, vinegar, and other items to sell for her general store business.

Erlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, rice, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, cooking oil, vinegar and other items to sell

loans.name: Roathmunny

texts.en:
Roathmunny is a 35-year-old married factory worker with four children in her care. She lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has been working in the factory for over four years. Her husband has a chainsaw and he cuts trees for payments. Among the four children, one is also working in the factory and three others are students. Together, they can make around USD 20 per day. 

Roathmunny has been building a house but she doesn’t have enough cement, so she would like to request a loan to buy cement to build a proper house. With this loan, she will have enough finances to build a proper house for the family to live in. In the future, she hopes to help the three children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy cement to build a proper house

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 59 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child in school.

Rogelia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rogelia has been in this business for 22 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rogelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Edison Alexander

texts.es:
Desde el año 2013 el señor Edison ha venido construyendo con mucho esfuerzo y empeño una forma de vida sostenible para él, su pareja y su pequeña de 8 años de edad, la falta de trabajo ha creado una necesidad latente y pro su sentido de responsabilidad creo un negocio el cual es la venta de alimentos como hamburguesas, perros calientes, arepas rellenas, patacones, vende refrescos, jugos naturales etc.
La razón que trae a Edison ante ustedes a solicitar un préstamo tiene que ver con sus aspiraciones y sueños de expansión, quiere tener un local mejor dotado, mejor pintado, hacer que sea un sitio donde disfrutes de una buena comida, que te sientas a gusto y quieran volver.
Por tal razón con el monto solicitado realizara algunas adecuaciones, comprara manteles, pintura, utensilios y materia prima para realizar los alimentos anteriormente mencionados.
texts.en:
Since the year 2013, Señor Edison has been building, with great effort and commitment, a form of sustainable life for himself, his partner, and their 8-year-old daughter. Joblessness has created a latent need. Because of his sense of responsibility, he created a business where he sells food, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, stuffed arepas, fried plantains, soft drinks, juices, etc.

The reason Edison comes before you, to apply for a loan, has to do with his aspirations and dreams of expansion. He wants his premises to be better equipped and better painted. He wants it to be a place where you can enjoy a good meal, where you feel comfortable, and where you will want to return.

For this reason, the requested amount will be used to make made some adjustments, and buy tablecloths, paint, utensils, and raw material to prepare the above mentioned food.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, paint, utensils, and raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a 68-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fely has a food production business in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Fely has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Karl

texts.en:
Karl is one of the most innovative, enthusiastic people you will ever meet. He has a strong passion for creative writing and making people laugh. A self-professed ‘couch comedian,’ Karl has been looking for a way to marry his two passions: entertaining people and making them smile. It was then that he came up with the idea for Carry-Jokey. 

What is Carry-Jokey you might ask? Carry-Jokey is a new innovative, concept in entertainment that combines the popularity of karaoke with the fun of standup comedy. It can be done in any place karaoke is performed: bars, nightclubs, restaurants, cafes, hotels, conference rooms, or in the comfort of your own home.

Karl will use his Kiva loan to develop the business and design the webpage and mobile application. His new website will contain 200 to 300 jokes, links to videos depicting the Carry-Jokey experience, photo links to comedians, and a subscription service, which will contain an extensive database of humor and advanced search capabilities.

“Everyone loves to make people laugh and to make others feel good,” stated Karl. “I am excited to create a product that does exactly that.” 

Karl lives with his wife Irene and he also has a passion for education; he works at a local university as an ESL instructor and tutors part-time.

loans.use: to develop the business and design the webpage and mobile application

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta lives in Ermera; she is married but she has no children. She is applying for a loan of $1500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes and she also sells in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more clothes such as  trousers, shorts, shirts, turtlenecks, t-shirts and other children's clothes to sell. 

Modesta has been involved in business activities since 2010; she started with her own working capital of $2500. She is earning a good income from selling her clothes because many people like to buy them, and so she is still happy to do her business. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to run her business from a bigger store. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, shirts, turtlenecks, t-shirts and other children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem is a 54-year-old widowed woman living in a rural village of the Phnom Srouch district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and raising pigs for more than 10 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth microloan for Kem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for another loan to buy more pigs for resale and use a portion of it to plow the fields. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Phnom Srouch district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Sarom is a 58-year-old mother of three. Rice farming is the main source of family’s income and the business which she and her husband have been in for more than 10 years. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day.

This is the ninth microloan for Sarom with Kiva’s partner and they completely paid back the first loans. She has successfully used the loan to better support her family. She is now applying for a loan to buy a secondhand tractor to better support her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice in a timely way, so as to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand tractor

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: It

texts.en:
It lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of three children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farm, which is located near her house. On her farm, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved with this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

Apart from the agriculture sector, she also has a small grocery store which provides a supplementary income for her family. During this time, her grocery store is running badly since it lacks a variety of items to satisfy the clients. Due to this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan now to buy more grocery items. She hopes that this loan will help her store become more popular and make more income as well. She is thankful to all the lenders with their financial support for poor people.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 22 years old and married with two children. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store including noodles, cooking oil, salts, aqua, cigarettes, sugar, detergents and other things to sell including soft drinks. She has been doing this business since 2009 with her own working capital of $100. She is married and she has four children. There are six members in the family: her, four children and her husband. She wants to open a big store in the future so she is taking this loan to have good management to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She also has animals like pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cooking oil, salts, aqua, cigarettes, sugar, detergents and other things to sell Including soft drinks.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Phnom Srouch district, Pha is 38 years old and married with one kid. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Pha has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She’s successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more plots of farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more plots of farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Luis Evelio

texts.es:
Luis un hombre, sonriente, trabajador, entregado a su familia de 63 años propietario de una panadería, donde es el primer trabajador que entra y el ultimo en irse, su sentido de responsabilidad y sentido de pertenencia es admirable y en el establecimiento se desempeña como el panadero.
Es un hombre casado con dos hijos ya mayores de edad, sus sueños son tener un negocio estable en el tiempo, generar empleo y comprar vivienda.
A través de un crédito el señor Luis quiere darle un impulso a su negocio y lo hará invirtiendo en materia prima para fabricar los deliciosos productos que se ven en la foto.
Para Luis el apoyo será primordial ya que al ser un hombre de avanzada edad, que no cuenta con una pensión solo queda trabajar arduo y sacar a delante su panadería para llevar el alimento de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis is a 63 year old, happy, hard-working man who's committed to his family and owns a bakery. He's the first worker to arrive and the last to leave, his sense of responsibility and sense of belonging is remarkable and he works as a baker in this establishment. He's a married man with two adult children, and his dreams are to have a stable business, create jobs, and purchase a home. Luis wants to push his business forward through a loan, by investing it in buying ingredients to make the delicious products seen in the photo.
For Luis this support will be essential, since he's an older man without a pension whose only option is to work hard and make his bakery succeed to put food on his family's table.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour to make the delicacies seen in the photo

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 41, lives in a rural area in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farm that is located near her house. On her farm, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved with this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

Apart from the agriculture sector, she also has a small grocery store that provides a supplementary income for her family. During this time, her grocery store is running badly since she lacks a variety of items to satisfy the clients. Due to this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan now to buy more grocery items. She hopes that this loan will help her store become more popular and make more income as well. She is thankful to all lenders with their financial support for people.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 67 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for 40 years and earns additional income from coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Yorn is a widowed woman living in a rural village in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for several years. 

This is the eighth micro loan for Yorn with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy household supplies. She hopes to grow healthy rice and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Phnom Srouch district, Phorn is 58 years old and married. 

She is a rice farmer. Having been in this business for about 10 years, she can currently earn about 32,000 KHR per day. 

This is Phorn's eleventh micro loan cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income and make a better living.
