Guy is a tailor and he creates clothing made from the traditional 'pagne' fabric, which he sells to his customers in order to earn his income. Guy buys his supplies twice a month from the Grand Marché in Lomé.
To be able to sew the designs desired by his customers, Guy is requesting this loan to help him buy the fabric, and the tools required for the job.
Guy intends to generate enough profit to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase six 'pagne' traditional pieces of fabric.

loans.name: Kimat

texts.en: Kimat is a wise woman. She grew up in remote district in Tajikistan. She is married with four children. About two years ago, she started a business raising cattle and selling them in an animal market. Kimat is asking for a 4000 TJS loan from KIVA to buy more cattle. She is planning to increase her income and to help with the family finances.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, 64, lives in Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has four children who are garment factory workers. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland that is located in her community. So far, she has been in this business for almost forty years. Currently, she requesting a KIVA loan through Hattha Kaksekar Limited to buy a motorbike. The motorbike will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can have a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 41, is a married woman from Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has five children; one is married and lives independently, while the other four are single and live under her support. To make a living, she opened a small store in her community to sell grocery items. So far, she has been involved in business for two years. She is able to make an income of USD $7.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living place for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Trot

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Preah Vihear province’s Kulen district, Trot is a 40-year-old mother of three children. She and her husband have been farming rice for several years. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

Trot has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles, and now, she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salvacion is 48 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Salvacion has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish net and other materials for fishing.

Salvacion has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Chorb

texts.en: Chorb is 39 years old, married with two children, and lives in a wooden house in the Tbeng Meanchey District of Presh Vihea Province, Cambodia. The main source of his family’s income is from growing soybeans. He has been in this business for almost five years. With the current business, he can earn about 43,000 KHR per day. He is applying for a loan to buy seeds for growing soybeans. This is the third loan for Chorb with VisionFund, and he has paid back the previous loans. With the previous loans, he was able to improve his livelihood. He hopes to increase his crop yield and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his farm

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en: Sanoat is a liberal woman. She lives in a remote district. She is divorced. She has two children. Sanoat is an experienced and challenged woman. She has been working almost fourteen years. She is a seller in a grocery store. She has a great number of satisfied clients around. Sanoat saved up money from her income and bought a house. Now, she does not have enough money for home renovation and she is seeking financial support to complete her renovation. Sanoat requested a 10,000 TJS loan from Kiva to buy materials for renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy materials for renovating her house.

loans.name: Maria Edit

texts.es:
María, está logrando tener más clientes satisfechos con sus productos, como las demandas son mayores necesita de capital para comprar harina, sal, azúcar, manteca, levadura y otros ingredientes para elaborar diferente clases de pan.
Su negocio es más rentable, cancela su deuda puntualmente y ha comprado electrodomésticos para el hogar.
texts.en:
María now has more customers satisfied with her products, as she is experiencing a higher demand.

She needs a loan to buy flour, salt, sugar, butter, yeast and other ingredients to make different types of bread.

Her business is more profitable, she is repaying her previous loan on time and she has bought electric appliances for her home.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, sugar, butter, yeast and other ingredients to make different types of bread.

loans.name: Gulrakat

texts.en: Gulrakat is a communicative woman. She was born in 1971. She is living in the southern part of the country. She is a widow. She has one child. For almost twenty years, she has been doing business trading children's wear. She has a place in the domestic market to sell her goods. Gulrakat wants to enlarge her business. She is planning to buy a new collection of clothes. She requested a 2,500 USD loan for buying an assortment of clothes for selling. Gulrakat awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ehson

texts.en: Ehson is a bright person. He was born in 1993. He is living in a rural area. He is single. Ehson is a student. He is studying at university. He is an active, communicative and gentle student. He is well known among friends and students. Teachers are all satisfied with his attendance. Ehson does not have enough money to pay his tuition fee. He is requesting a 390 USD loan for paying his tuition fee. He hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fee.

loans.name: Eleman

texts.en:
Eleman is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Software Engineering. Here is his story:

“Now I am very in need of a Kiva loan. This assistance will give me the opportunity to study at one of the best universities in our region, which offers the most important excellent knowledge and the opportunity to study abroad, quality facilities, a good close-knit and supportive atmosphere, and highly qualified teachers. Since childhood my parents have made a huge contribution to my academic success, putting their high hopes in my future endeavors. I fully believe in my strength and capabilities and hope for your understanding and support.

Except me there are three children in my family: two younger brothers, who go to school, and a younger sister, who goes to the kindergarten. My father is a beginner entrepreneur at one of the local markets as an implementer of building materials. His profit depends on sale and season. There is no contruction in winter and spring, so my father’s income has noticeably decreased. My mother is a manager at a local firm and gets around 100 USD per month. Actually, we have one more temporary member of my family, my cousin. He came from a village and studies in Bishkek. His family doesn’t have a house in our city and they are too poor to rent one for him. Even though it’s hard to meet ends for my family, we are able to help him as he is our relative. After he gets a degree, he will leave our house.

I am ambitious and willing to study to conquer the peaks of knowledge. Also, with pleasure, I will take part in the university’s life and I’m ready to act in order to prove that I am truly worthy of financial support.

Giving me a loan, you contribute to my education, not only to my future, but to my family’s, as I am the eldest child in the family, I am the person, who will be the good example for my siblings and will be the investor in their education.”

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fee.

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
María, elabora tortillas para vender a sus vecinos, es una persona muy dedicada a su familia la cual está formada por ella y sus hijos, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy  transitable, por tal razón sus ingresos son estables y lo tiene desde hace dos años. Anteriormente tenía una granja de pollos pero se la cedió a uno de sus hijos.
Se comprara maíz, bolsas, cal y gas propano para tener mayor productividad de tortillas y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, con la inversión busca atraer nuevos clientes para que las ventas y ganancias sean mayores, pues de esa manera cubrir las necesidades que surgen en su hogar.
María desea seguir creciendo con su negocio, adquirir experiencia en el uso de préstamos y dar a su familia un hogar con menos necesidades.
texts.en:
María makes tortillas to send to her neighbors. She is very dedicated to her family, which consists of her and her children. Her business is located in a very walkable area, and for this reason her income is stable and has been for two years. She previously had a chicken farm but she gave it to one of her sons.

She will buy corn, bags, lime and propane gas to have a greater production of tortillas and to meet the demands of her customers. With this investments she seeks to attract new customers so that her sales and profits are higher, so in this way she can cover the necessities that arise in her home.

Maria desires to continue growing her business, to acquire experience in the use of loans and to give her family a home with fewer needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, lime and propane to have greater production of tortillas and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Furaha Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is James, a member of Furaha Self Help Group. He is 24 years old and and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in April 2014.

James works in maize, beans and potato farming to earn a living. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he is now able to manage his business more effectively. James is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase two goats and fodder. He will resell them when they are mature and earn a profit. This will enable James to support his needs and create a firm foundation for his future.

James is grateful for Kiva and the support of their lenders, and he promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase fodder and two goats to help boost farming to raise family income

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Joseph. He is a 31-year-old single man. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in April 2014.

Joseph is a maize, beans and dairy farmer. He is grateful to HiH EA for developing his entrepreneurial skills through the enterprise management training. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase cow feeds that will help maintain a consistent milk supply. He hopes this will improve milk production, enabling him to earn profits so he can support his needs such as food and medical care.

Joseph is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase cow feeds that will help boost milk production.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro is a hospitable woman. She was born in 1989. She lives in a remote district. She is qualified and experienced in business. She is divorced and has two children. It is hard for her to feed a family by herself. She has a business of buying and selling sweets and candies. She wants to improve her standard of living. Zuhro is seeking a loan of 4,950 TJS, to buy construction supplies to renovate her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and renovate her house.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: The person in the photo is Magdaline She is 26 years old and has four children, who are in primary school. She is married and lives with her husband and their children. She runs a kiosk and engages in maize farming. She is taking out a loan to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers. She hopes that her business will do well, and that this will enable her to improve her income level. This will in turn help her to provide food and pay school fees for her children.  Magdaline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, to boost her farming activities.

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
Bader is a special needs client from Iraq. He is a 39 year old married man, who has 4 children.

Bader has a car repair shop and opened his own workshop in 1999. He learned this profession from childhood. Now he has a great deal of experience and a good reputation in the surrounding area.

Bader applied for a loan amounting to $3,000 to buy his own car. He aims to grow his business to have better living standards for his family and to meet all his children's needs.

loans.use: to buy his own car.

loans.name: Rakhshanda

texts.en:
"The ability to fulfill your dreams lies in your hands," says Rakhshanda, a 33 year old woman who has been running a school for the last five years. Rakhshanda's goal is to provide quality education for the children in her community, and she has worked hard to bring her school to where it is today. There are over 120 students in the school.

In order to provide them with adequate furniture such as chairs and tables along with black boards, she has requested a loan of PKR 75,000. Rakhshanda wants to have a better life for herself and her family as well as for the children who are studying in her school.  Rakhshanda believes that hard work is the key to success. She is prepared to work hard.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as chairs and tables along with black boards

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: The person in the photo is Teresia. She is the mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in April 2014. Teresia grows maize and beans and is a dairy farmer. She is grateful to HiH EA for the enterprise training that has enabled her to commercialize her farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase dairy goats. She hopes this will increase her productivity and thus produce more income. This will enable her to provide for her family’s needs, such as food and education for her grandchild. Teresia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats to help boost her milk production and increase her family's income.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: The person in the photo is Nancy. She is 31 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their four children. She is a dairy and poultry farmer. She has applied for a loan to buy poultry feed to boost her poultry farming activities. She looks forward to improved productivity and thus an increase in her income, which will help her improve the family’s living standards in such areas as better health and quality education. Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed to improve production and increase her family's income.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: The person in the photo is Monicah. She is a 41-year-old married mother of two children, who are in primary school. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training has helped her improve her existing knowledge and acquire new knowledge about enterprise management, record-keeping and financial management. She is a vegetable farmer. She is taking out a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and manure. This will help improve her crop yield and lead to a bountiful harvest. She looks forward to an improved income, which will help her to pay school fees for the children. Monicah is happy with Kiva and their lenders, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure, in order to improve crop yields and  thus increase her income.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza is a challenged woman. She was born in 1979 and is a widow with two children. She lives in a remote district. It is hard for her to provide for and feed her children alone.

Feruza has a business trading grocery products. Year by year she is improving her business turnover. She wants to have better living conditions. Feruza is asking for financial support to buy materials and construction supplies for renovating her house.

She awaits Kiva project member’s mercy.

loans.use: to buy materials and construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Sarit

texts.en:
Sarit is a 20-year-old single student who is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in information technology. He is in his first year at university in the city. He is from Pursat province in Cambodia. His parents are farmers.

Due to the fact that he is short of finances to pay his university fees from the first to the second year, Sarit would like to take out a loan. With this loan, he will earn an associate’s degree successfully and earn skills to find a job.

For his dreams, he wants a job with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to save money to run his own business. He also wants to own a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees from the first to the second year

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's work as a turner and to repair his lathe machine.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

Chona requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Chona would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 45 year old married woman. She has been running a school for the past 16 years.

Azra believes that the key to success is hard work. She had always wanted to work in education so that she could provide opportunities for the children in her community. Azra is committed to her school and wants to make it grow. Her school has a valued reputation in the community and she does not have space for new enrollment. She has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 to construct three classrooms to accommodate more students in her school.

loans.use: to construct three classrooms to accommodate more students in her school.

loans.name: Kuuga Na Gwika Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Hannah. She is 61 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She is a member of Kuuga na Gwika Women Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to receive training on enterprise and financial management. She engages in raising poultry and dairy farming, and also runs a kiosk.

Hannah previously borrowed from HiH EA Enterprise Incubation Fund, a loan she repaid promptly. She now requests a loan through Kiva to purchase feeds and improve productivity. Hannah believes this improvement will raise her income and help pay school fees for her children. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the great support.

loans.use: To buy dairy and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Ruth. She is married and a mother of four children. She is 71 years old and she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

For the last nine years, Ruth has done maize and beans farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development and she has been able to turn this business to a profitable commercial venture. 

Ruth is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy quality fertilizer and other farm inputs to enhance production. This will improve her income, thus help support her family's basic needs.

Ruth is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and she promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will help boost farm production.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Rosemary. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training on enterprise and financial management. She is 28 years old, married and a mother of three children.

She operates a second hand clothes selling business. She is borrowing money from Kiva to add more stock to her business to help improve sales which will in return increase her profit. Thus, she will be able to support her children's education by paying school fees.

Rosemary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of second hand clothes for resale and increase her income.

loans.name: Chhieb

texts.en:
Chhieb is a 24-year-old single student who lives in the Pursat province in Cambodia. She is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in information technology in the first year. Her parents are farmers. 

Chhieb does not have the finances to pay tuition fees from the first to the second year, so she is requesting a loan. This loan will help her to graduate. She dreams of working in a good company and being able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old and married with five children, two in school. Janet works very hard to provide for her family.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Janet has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Don Béni Group

texts.fr: Bahati est une commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Don Béni», âgée de 32 ans, mariée à un médecin.  Elle est vendeuse  de bijoux à domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des bijoux en or, en argent, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite avoir une meilleure place de vente au marché central et construire une maison pour la famille. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Bahati is a trader and a member of the Don Béni credit group. She is 32 years old and married to a doctor. She sells jewellery door-to-door in a busy street in town. She has been doing this for four years. She is requesting this loan from Hekima so she can grow her business. She wishes to purchase gold and silvery jewellery, among other items. It is her wish to have a better stall at the central market and to be able to build a home for her family. She wishes to thank Hekima for the support they give to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver jewellery, among other items

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 30 years old, married and lives with his wife and their three children. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has applied for a loan to buy textile fabric and sewing thread for his tailoring business. He hopes this will help satisfy his customers' needs and earn more income to help him improve his living standards and provide better health care and quality education for his children.
Wilson is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy textile fabric and sewing thread to improve his business and earn a better income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her stitching work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to receive training on enterprise development and financial management. She is 47 years old, married, and blessed with four children. She lives with her family.

Jane's business is dairy and vegetable farming. She is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and manure to improve her farm output. She looks forward to increasing her income to support her family's basic needs. She is happy for Kiva’s help and support.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and manure.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru: Иван, 56 лет, женат, есть дочь- студентка. Образование у Ивана среднее. Уже 3 года он успешно занимается разведением кур, гусей, уток и кроликов. Дома есть инкубатор. Иван добился хороших результатов, у него есть 25 гусей, 20 уток, 15 кроликов и куры. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Иван обратился в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кур и корма. На прибыль от кредита он планирует приобрести дойную корову, чтобы продавать молоко. А также накопить на постройку бани у себя дома.
texts.en:
Ivan is 56, married, and has a daughter who is a student.  He has a secondary school education.  For the past three years, he's been a successful livestock farmer, raising chickens, geese, ducks and rabbits.  He has an incubator at home.  Ivan has achieved good results with his farming, and currently has 25 geese, 20 ducks, and 15 rabbits and chickens.  

For the future development of his business, Ivan has requested a loan of 45,000 som from Bai-Tushum Bank to buy chickens and feed.  He plans on using his extra earnings due to the loan to buy a dairy cow to sell milk, as well as building a sauna for his home.

loans.use: buy chickens and poultry feed to invest in his business

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is 35 years old and a married woman with ten children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma.Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Ma.Nenita requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Ma.Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José de  45 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, no continuó por la distancia que había entre el lugar donde vivía hacia pueblo, se casó a los 20 años y su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, sus hijos estudian y dependen de él.


José se dedica a la construcción, él es albañil, trabajo que aprendió como ayudante, además se dedica a la agricultura y es así como lleva los granos básicos a su casa. Él va a diversos lugares a trabajar en construcción y se moviliza en bicicleta y a pie, el trabajo agrícola lo realiza a un kilómetro de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar 5 cerdos de engorde y concentrado para criarlos y luego venderlos.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y salir adelante con su esfuerzo, y con esto apoyar a  sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
José  is 45 years old. He studied up to sixth grade. He was not able to continue because of the distance between his house and the town. He married at 20 and his wife works in household chores. His children study and depend on him. 
Jose works in construction: he is a bricklayer. He learned this work as an assistant first. Also, he is a farmer, and this is how he brings basic grains to his home. He goes to different places to work in construction, and he travels by bicycle and by foot. He works in a farm located one kilometer away from his house, and his work schedule is 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. He needs a loan to buy 5 pigs for fattening and concentrated food to raise them for later sale. His dream is to continue working and move ahead with his effort, and with this to support his children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs for fattening and concentrated food to raise them for later sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase their working capital and purchase metal sheets and bags of cement, which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's business manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin de   31 años de edad, estudió primer año de bachillerato, no logró terminar por razones familiares y económicas, su madre falleció  cuando cursaba su bachillerato, fue su mayor desánimo a continuar su formación académica. Está acompañado y su esposa se encuentra en el extranjero con la cual procrearon 2 hijos.

Edwin se dedica a la construcción, se desempeña como albañil, trabajo que aprendió al ser ayudante de albañil y que realiza desde los 12 años, los pocos ingresos que recibían sus padres le obligo a poder aprender a trabajar desde pequeño. No tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, la distancia que recorre varía de acuerdo al lugar donde le demande el trabajo, se moviliza en bicicleta y a pie y su horario de trabajo es de  7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta, ya que pierde demasiado tiempo en viajar y muchas veces donde va no hay transporte por lo que le urge un medio de transporte propio.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y salir adelante con su esfuerzo, y con esto apoyar a  sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Edwin is 31 years old. He studied up to tenth grade, but couldn't finish his studies because of family and financial reasons. His mother died when he was attending high school, and he felt too discouraged to continue with his studies. He is in a relationship, and his common-law wife is currently abroad. They have two children.

Edwin makes a living in construction. He works as a mason, an occupation that he learned when he was a mason's assistant and that he has been following since he was 12 years old. The low income that their parents used to earn forced him to learn to work from a very young age. He doesn't follow any other occupations. The distance he travels varies according to where his work is required. He travels on foot or by bicycle, and he works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle because he wastes too much time commuting, and, on many occasions, where he goes there is no public transportation available. This is why he badly needs his own means of transportation.

His dream is to keep on working and getting ahead so that he can provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase toy parts to assemble and sell.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 30 year old married woman and a mother of 3 children (one of her children is also shown in the photo).

The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper repair and maintenance. For this reason; Bushra has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her son

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Teresiah. She is married and living with her husband and their children. She keeps dairy cows to earn a living.

She has applied for a loan to buy dairy feeds to help improve milk productivity. She believes this will ensure she maintains a stable milk supply and will thus have more income to cater for the family needs.

Teresiah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed for dairy cows to increase milk production for better returns.

loans.name: Tujiunge Pamoja Group

texts.fr: Saasita est commerçante, présidente du groupe  de crédits «Tujiunge Pamoja», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 47 ans, mère 8 enfants qui tous  étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse grossiste des huiles palmes dans un dépôt de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 2500 litres d’huiles. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses  enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Saasita is a trader and the president of the Tujiunge Pamoja credit group, a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 48-year-old married mother to eight children who are all currently receiving an education. She started her business with funds given to her by her husband. She earns a living through selling palm oil wholesale at a warehouse in town. She has been doing this for 10 years. She would like to purchase 2500 litres of palm oil. She wishes to increase her working capital, as well as see her children educated and well fed. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs outside of the banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 2500 litres of palm oil

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga, es una persona responsable de dar a su familia lo necesario para subsistir, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y tres hijos de 16, 10 y 6 años de edad, su actividad económica principal es dedicarse al comercio de productos de primera necesidad, comenta que es un negocio que necesita tiempo y buena administración para mantenerlo con vida, la tienda está instalada en su vivienda por lo que no paga alquiler, lo fundo hace 6 años y lo atiende junto a su familia.
Utilizará el crédito para costear los costos de la recolección de una manzana de maíz cultivada, además adquirirá arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, jugos, etc., para surtir la tienda, fortalecerá el negocio y generara las ganancias necesarias para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar. Su riesgo es la delincuencia que existe en la zona.
Su objetivo es seguir trabajando para tener un negocio más estable, reducir el nivel de deudas que posee y apoyar en los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Olga is a person responsible for providing her family with the necessities of life.  She currently lives with her life partner and three children ages 16, 10 and 6.  Her main source of income comes from selling everyday goods and supplies, and says that it's a business which demands both time and good management to keep it viable.  The store is set up in her home as she doesn't have to pay rent that way.  She set up her store 6 years ago, and runs it together with her family.     

She will use her loan to pay for expenses related to harvesting a plot of corn, as well as to buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs, juice etc. to replenish her store's stock.  This will strengthen her business and generate the necessary earnings to improve her family's living conditions.  Her risk is the crime present in her area.  Her goal is to continue working to be able to have a more stable business, to reduce the level of debt she has, and to help pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: pay for expenses related to harvesting a plot of   corn and buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs, juice etc. to replenish her store's stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow and sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Gulchehrahon

texts.ru: Гулчехрахон 39 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 19 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. Гулчехрахон недавно продала скот, сейчас занимается преимущественно варащиванием картофеля на 0,27 Га собственной земли. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулчехрахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), полученные средства она направит на покупку семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. Гулчехрахон является лидером группы "Уйгур-Абад". Доходы от кредита помогут ей в будущем развить ее бизнес и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulchehrahon is 39 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for 19 years. Gulchehrahon recently sold livestock and is now mainly involved in growing potatoes on 0.27 hectares of her own land. The monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulchehrahon requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers. Gulchehrahon is the leader of the "Uygur-Abad" group. The earnings from the loan will help her develop her business in the future and save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sohibahon

texts.ru: Сохибахон, 40 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Сохибахон среднее образование, она 20 лет в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сохибахон, на данный момент она на участке мерою 0,46 Га выращивает картофель, огурцы и помидоры. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для теплицы, семян огурцов, удобрений. Сохибахон является участником группы "Уйгур-Абад", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Sohibahon is 40 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Sohibahon has a secondary education and, to provide additional income for her family, has been involved in farming for 20 years. Thanks to Sohibahon's hard work, she currently grows potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes on 0.46 hectares of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy plastic for a greenhouse, cucumber seeds and fertilizers. Sohibahon is a participant of the "Uygur-Abad" group that, besides her, consists of 3 more people, with 4 people all together. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic for a greenhouse, cucumber seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: Kyeya est un artiste, secrétaire  de la banque communautaire Bora, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 11 enfants dont 3 vont à l’école et 8 n’étudient pas. Elle commença son business avec de fonds recu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des œuvres d’art au marché central de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va acheter des matériels pour la préfabrication. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kyeya is an artist and the secretary for the Bora community bank, a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 42-year-old married mother to 11 children, 3 of which currently attend school while the other 8 are not receiving an education. She started her business with funds given to her by her husband. She earns a living through selling her artworks at the central market. She has been doing this for 15 years. She wishes to use this loan to purchase materials for her art. She wishes to obtain further loans, as well as to see her children educated and well fed. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs outside of the banking system.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her art

loans.name: Ukulima Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Lucy; a member of Ukulima Women Group. She is fifty-eight years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Lucy runs a livestock-selling business to earn a living. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on record keeping, enterprise, and financial management has equipped her with the skills to run her enterprise efficiently. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy cattle for resale in order to increase her income so as to cater for her family’s needs such as food, clothing, and school fees.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale and increase her family's income.

loans.name: Vrigilia

texts.en: Vrigilia has been involved in business activities since 2013. She started her business with her own working capital of 500 USD. She also cultivates animals, like pigs, chickens and dogs. Vrigilia is married, and there are 4 members in the family, including her husband. Her husband is a farmer. Vrigilia has a shop in her business. She is requesting a loan of 600 USD from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to what people like, including candies, eggs, noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts, cigarettes, coffee, soft drinks and hard drinks. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy candies, eggs, noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts, cigarettes, coffee and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is 23 years old and married with one child. Imee works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Imee has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Evelio, se dedica a vender gas propano, no tiene un horario fijo, ofrece servicio a domicilio a sus clientes, la desventaja la competencia que tiene en la localidad, Evelio únicamente vive con su abuela, tiene que cuidar de ella y cubrir los gastos del hogar.
EL capital lo necesita para comprar cilindros de gas de otra empresa, lo que le permitirá variar su producto, aumentar la clientela e ingresos, espera que la inversión tenga resultados positivos en su negocio y en la vida familiar.
Aspira a tener mejor equipado el negocio para que su situación económica mejore y dar a su abuela los cuidados necesarios para una vida digna.
texts.en:
Evelio earns his living selling propane gas. He doesn't have fixed working hours, but offers a home delivery service to his customers, and his main challenge is the local competition. Evelio lives with his grandmother, and he has to care for her and cover all the household costs.

He needs the loan in order to buy gas cylinders from another company, which will allow him to expand his product range, and so increase his customer base and his income. He hopes that the investment will have positive results in both his business and his family life.

He aspires to have a better-equipped business so that his financial situation improves and so that he can give his grandmother the care she needs for a decent life.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders from another company and so expand his product range.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 25 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Robelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Robelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Robelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 29 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom attend school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Charlyn requested her sixteenth loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Charlyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her husband's general store

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
Manuel de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, los pocos ingresos que generaban sus padres no le permitió continuar sus estudios, está casado desde los 22 años y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian.   

Él es empleado, trabaja en una alcaldía, se desempeña como auxiliar de logística, trabajo que desempeña hace 15 años, lo contrataron por medio un amigo suyo que trabajaba en el mismo lugar quien lo recomendó para el puesto, y poco a poco fue desempeñándose y lograr una contratación definitiva, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, antes de este laborar en la alcaldía, se dedicaba a trabajar en como promotor de salud. La distancia que recorre es de 1 km, el recorrido lo realiza a pie y trabaja en un horario de  8:00 am a 4:00 pm. 


Él necesita el crédito para comprar  láminas, polines, tornillos y pagar la mano de obra para ponerle techo a su casa. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para sus necesidades y las de su familia, espera darle a sus hijos todo en apoyo para que sigan estudiando y se preparan para que puedan ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 49 years old, he studied until sixth grade, the small income that his parents generated would not allow him to continue his studies. He has been married since he was 22 years old and his wife takes care of the home. He has three children, of whom two are studying.

He is employed and works in a mayor's office as a logistical assistant, a job which he has done for 15 years. He got the job by way of a friend of his who worked in the same place who recommended him for the job, and little by little he was able to perform in the role and gained a permanent contract.  

He does not carry out any other work,before working in the mayor's office he worked in health promotion. He travels 1km to work on foot and works from 8am until 4pm. 

Manuel needs the loan to buy steel sheets, roofing supports and bolts, and pay for manual labour to put a roof on his house.

His dream is to continue working to supply his needs and those of his family, he hopes to give his children all possible support so they can continue to study and prepare so that they can become somebody in life.

loans.use: to buy steel sheets, roofing supports and bolts, and pay for manual labour to put a roof on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support her son's business by purchasing embroidery materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Shabnum

texts.en:
Shabnum is a 31-year-old married mother of two children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband earns a very low income.

Shabnum owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from home. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it, and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies of the town like her garment collection and selection a lot.

The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has started, and people are demanding warmer clothes. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings. She has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of garments to fulfill the demand.

Shabnum wishes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase garments for reselling.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Letecia works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock and from a ready-to-wear clothing business. Letecia is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old. She is married and has one child. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, where she raises pigs. Arlene has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Minda works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending. Minda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bunches of bananas to sell to customers.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lilian

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a atender su tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive con sus hijos, pero ya no dependen de ella, no tiene familiares en el extranjero, ella sola atiende y administra el negocio, tiene varios años de haber hecho la apertura del negocio, con los ingresos que esté le genera cubre sus gastos personales y otros compromisos.
Para mejorar el inventario solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, papel  higiénico, detergente, jabón, pan, entre otros productos con los que fortalecerá el negocio, espera que sus clientes tengan más afluencia para generar más ventas y mejores ganancias. La dificultad es que el negocio tiene días buenos y malos.
Para Blanca su sueño es tener un negocio con bases estables que le ayuden a tener ingresos para que en el futuro ella pueda tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Blanca earns her living running a shop that sells basic necessities. She lives with her children, although they are no longer dependent on her, and she does not have any family members abroad. She attends to and manages her business alone, and it is now several years since she opened the shop. With the income she makes from it she is able to cover her personal costs and other financial commitments.

So as to improve her stock, she is seeking a loan to buy staple grains, toilet paper, detergent, soap, bread, and other products to strengthen her business. 

She hopes that her customers will be better off so that she will be able to make more sales and a better income. Her main difficulty is that the business has good days and bad days. Blanca's dream is to have a stable business that will give her an income that allows her to have a more decent life in the future.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, toilet paper, detergent, soap, bread, and other products to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 55-year-old married woman. The man shown in the picture is one of her sons. Razia and her son have been doing hand embroidery work for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she earns enough through her skill to meet the expenses of her family.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones, etc. for embellishment. With this purchase, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful that she will increase her income by attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones, etc.

loans.name: Sayidahon

texts.ru: Сайидахон  44 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 24 года она занимается сельским хозяйством. Сайидахон занимается полеводством, на 0,36 Га собственной земельной доли она выращивает картофель и помидоры. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайидахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля, помидор, капусты, клеенки для теплицы и минеральных удобрений. Сайидахон является участником группы "Уйгур-Абад", в которой кроме нее состоит еще 3 человека. Доходы от кредита помогут ей в будущем развить бизнес и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sayidahon is 44 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for 24 years. Sayidahon is involved in farming and grows potatoes and tomatoes on 0.36 hectares of her own land. The monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Sayidahon requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato, tomato and cabbage seeds, plastic for a greenhouse and mineral fertilizers. Sayidahon is a participant of the "Uygur-Abad" group that, besides her, consists of 3 more people. The earnings from the loan will help develop her business in the future and save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy potato, tomato and cabbage seeds, plastic for a greenhouse and mineral fertilizers in order to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Elma Yaneth

texts.es:
Elma de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado,  la situación económica no le permitió seguir los estudios, se casó a los 23 años, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura, de los ocho hijos que tiene cinco estudian y los demás no tienen la edad por lo que la familia la conforman diez personas.
 

      Elma se dedica a la venta de tamales, pasteles, y a lavar ropa a personas particulares, trabajos que hace desde unos cinco años, se dedico hacer esto porque en su casa solo el esposo era el único que llevaba ingresos y no eran suficientes, para vender tiene que recorrer unas seis cuadras todos los días por las tardes mientras que su hija mayor hace oficios de la casa.


Ella solicita este crédito para pagar alquiler de terreno donde sembrará granos básicos.
 
Ella espera que el sueño le favorezca sacando una buena cosecha pues piensa en su familia pero esto lo va a lograr si su préstamo es aprobado.
texts.en:
Elma is 41 years old. She studied until the 6th grade, the economic situation did not allow her to continue with her studies. She got married at 23 years old, her husband earns a living doing agricultural jobs. Of the eight children she has, five study and the others are not yet old enough to do so. The family is made up of 10 people in total. 

Elma earns a living selling tamales, pastries, and washing clothes for people, work that she has done for about five years. She earns her living doing this because in her house the husband was the only one who earned an income and it was not sufficient. To sell she has to go about six blocks every day in the evenings while her eldest daughter does the household tasks.

She is asking for this loan in order to pay rent for land where she will sow basic grains.

She hopes that dreams will favour her in gathering a good harvest, as she thinks about her family and she will achieve this if her loan is approved.

loans.use: to pay rental of land where she will sow basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель, 36 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование- высшее, с 1998 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Асель, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее развитое хозяйство, 4 коровы, 2 лошади и 15 овец. Ежедневно она продает экологически чистое, домашнее и очень вкусное молоко. Среднемесячный доход Асель около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, что позволит ей достойно вырастить детей.
texts.en: Asel is 36, married, and the mother of four children. She has a college education and has been planting crops and raising livestock since 1998. Thanks to her hard work, Asel currently has a well-developed farm with four cows, two horses, and 15 sheep. She sells homemade, delicious organic milk every day and her average monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her farm, she applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows. She plans to use the profits to invest in the growth of her business, enabling her to properly raise her children.

loans.use: to purchase cows and invest in her business

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Машхура, 31 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Машхуры среднее образование, она 11 лет назад в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи стала заниматься полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Машхуры, на данный момент у нее есть участок мерою 0,09 Га, где она выращивает капусту, огурцы и помидоры. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений. Машхура является одним из 4 участников группы "Уйгур-Абад". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и хочет накопить на приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en: Mashkhura is 31 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. Mashkhura has a secondary education and, to provide additional income for her family, became involved in farming 11 years ago. Thanks to Mashkhura's hard work, today she has a land plot of 0.09 hectares, where she grows cabbage, cucumbers and tomatoes. The monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy seeds and fertilizers. Mashkhura is one of the 4 participants of the "Uygur-Abad" group. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business and wants to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to grow eco-friendly vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the labor costs of cleaning the site and to begin putting up the four walls of her home, since her dream of having a home would only be possible with financing.

loans.name: L’Union Group

texts.fr: Kanane est une commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre d’un collectif de crédits «L’union», âgée de 29 ans, mère de 8 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de divers pagnes dans un magasin de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 160 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Kanane is a trader, she and her husband help each other, and she is a member of the credit collective "L'Union".  She is aged 29 and mother of 8 children who are in school.  She has been selling a range of fabrics in a shop in the town for 5 years.  

She is seeking a loan from Hekima to grow her business.  She will buy 160 lengths of fabric.   In doing this, she hopes to grow her capital, educate and feed her children.  She thanks Hekima for the care given to women entrepreneurs who cannot access the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy 160 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia has successfully built her business of milk selling with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase one more cow to increase milk production capacity. This will enable her to increase her sales to more areas and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow to increase milk production capacity.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат, 40 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, они взрослые и самостоятельные. У Салтанат - высшее образование, уже 7 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав с 15,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Салтанат в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 25 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га арендованной и 1,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Так как сельское хозяйство - единственный источник дохода семьи Салтанат, она в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки теленка и жеребенка. Доходы от кредита Салтанат хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на развитие полеводческой деятельности.
texts.en: Saltanat is 40 years old, married and a mother of 3 children, all of whom are grown and independent. Saltanat has a college education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 7 years. Having started with 15,000 som (KGS), thanks to hard work, today Saltanat has 2 cows and 25 sheep. She grows on beans for sale on approximately 1.0 hectare of leased and 1.0 hectare of owned land. Her monthly income amounts to 7,000 som (KGS). Because agriculture provides the sole source of income for Saltanat's family, she requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a foal and a calf in order to develop her business further. Saltanat wants to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing her livestock headcount and plans to save money to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a calf and a foal in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia, 33 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shopkeeping business. She offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Rabia needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand.

Rabia has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, rice, biscuits, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, rice, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina lives in Ermera. She is married and has four children. She has been involved in business activities since 2011. She started with her own working capital of $100.

She is a businesswoman and has a shop for her business. She is also selling in the market, so she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business.

She is very interested in her business, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, cooking oils, detergents, notebooks, hand and body lotion, and other things to sell.

She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and because she hopes to open a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oils, detergents, notebooks, hand and body lotion, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bed sheets, perfume and bags to resell

loans.name: Omina

texts.en: Omina is a businesswoman. She was born in 1951. She is living in a rural area. She is a widow. Since 2003, she has been busy keeping livestock and selling them in the animal market. Nevertheless, after participation in startup training she decided to open a new business. Omina understood that the actual business nowadays is sewing pillows, traveling rugs, mats, etc. She wants to develop her idea and make further business, but she needs to buy a new sewing machine and fabric. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric. She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Anacleta works hard to support her family.

Anacleta has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Anacleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Merlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Merlinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: 's husband to purchase plastic furniture, chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. for his restaurant.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Naseem is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as thread of different colors, lace, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as thread of different colors, lace, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: 's husband to maintain his rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: 's husband to fix his rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bed sheets and shoes to resell

loans.name: Robiyahon

texts.en: Robiyahon is an experienced and challenged person. She was born in 1958. She is divorced. She has one son. She was busy keeping livestock. Now she is planning to have a new business in the sphere of service. Robiyahon wants to open a cafe for local citizens of her area. Her son is supporting her with preparations to open a cafe. She requested a 5000 TJS loan to start up her business and buy needed equipment and products.

loans.use: To buy needed equipment and products

loans.name: Ralyn

texts.en:
Ralyn is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store, e-loading (mobile prepaid load), and plastic wares businesses. 

Ralyn requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional ingredients for her coffee business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her coffee business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more purified water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: enable her son to maintain his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her son to purchase a moto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. Her husband is a carpenter, but his income is not enough to support their basic consumption. Janeth started her sari-sari (grocery) store with an initial capital outlay of 2,000 PHP to supplement the family's income.

Janeth decided to join Paglaum because of the program and services offered to its members. Her sari sari sales are good, so she is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy additional commodities to meet client demand.  

Janeth hopes and prays, through her expanding grocery store, to offer a job to their neighbor and enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ablorzuhoé

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Ablorzuhoé  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier d’Apédokoè avec ses cinq enfants à sa charge. Ablorzuhoé est très dynamique et vend de la pâte emballée préparée à l’aide du maïs pour ses clients. Son activité ne lui procure pas assez de bénéfices pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Ablorzuhoé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé. Ablorzuhoé demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs  de maïs afin de préparer une bonne quantité de ses nourritures aux clients et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Aged 55, Ablorzuhoé is a married woman living in the neighbourhood of ’Apédokoè with responsibility for her 5 children.  Ablorzuhoé is very dynamic and sells packaged corn mash prepared with sweetcorn for her clients.  Her business does not bring her enough income to help with the family needs.

Ablorzuhoé stocks up once a month at the market in Adidogomé. Ablorzuhoé is requesting this loan to order sacks of corn to prepare a good quantity of food for her customers and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil, honey, brooms, lemon juice . . . to resell

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 40-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the picture is her husband.  

They are running a small general store to meet their household expenses. They have three children. Suriya wants to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, beverages, etc. to meet the increasing demand at their store. 

Suriya is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, beverages, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hard working mother who has been supporting her two children for the past six years through her snack-vending enterprise. 

Very happy knowing that Paglaum offers programs and services that help its members, Estrella wants to increase her sales volume and so is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for her snack vending.

Estrella hopes to have her own snack and refreshment store someday and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. Gemma has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in her current line of work for 13 years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house.

Her husband also assists her by purchasing merchandise from the market and sitting at the shop, dealing with customers. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products. They make enough to meet the expenses of their three children.

Shagufta has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, to cater to more customers' needs and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to cater to more customers' needs and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en: Bunthan is a 30-year-old married man with no children. He is from the Banteay Meanchey province of Cambodia, where he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree with a major in management, and in his second year at university in the city. He is also working as a seller in a company and has been in this line of work for about a year. His wife is 27 years old and also works as a seller. Both Bunthan and his wife make a daily income of $17. Bunthan lacks the money he needs to pay his second-year tuition fees, and therefore has requested a loan which he will use to complete his second year successfully. After graduation, he hopes to find another job with a decent salary so he can improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to pay his second-year tuition fees

loans.name: Shabona

texts.en:
Shabona is a cheerful woman who was born in 1994. She is single and lives with her parents in a remote district. She likes to be helpful and useful to her family and society.

Shabona has five years’ experience in sewing and sews beautiful traditional dresses for women. She attracts many satisfied customers from around her area. She wants to buy a sewing machine that will help her expand her dressmaking capabilities.

She has requested a loan of 3,000 TJS for support to buy the sewing machine. She believes that this KIVA project will be merciful.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky, 35, is married with four children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 6 years already. 

The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children and their health needs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. 

Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her family. 

She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is applying again for a loan for restocking her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a widow and has 8 children. She signed up for membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. 

She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Lilian is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. 

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with items like canned goods and other basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods and other basic commodities.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally lives in Labo, Ozamiz City, and she is married. In order to survive, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store.

 It began with displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar and a dozen of shampoo and soap. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari store in January of 2010. She became a member in good standing, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 12,000PHP to pay for additional inventories to draw more customers to buy in her store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional inventories to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 39-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Kericho area of Kenya, and is blessed with a lovely family which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future. Grace was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and has space there to use for dairy farming. She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kericho is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Grace, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business.Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 50 years old, married and has three children. She works in agriculture, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan from NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Annie has been farming vegetables for 25 years, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain and improve her business. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
