Samwel is a 65-year-old proud father of eleven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of ten farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Samwel has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Samwel described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Samwel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Olawalé

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Olawalé est une jeune fille célibataire qui vit à Adidogomé. Olawalé est très dynamique et ne dépend de personne pour pourvoir à ses besoins quotidiens. Pour assurer ses charges, Olawalé vend des pagnes de grande marque dans une boutique du quartier et réalise un revenu favorable. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par mois. Pour aménager son propre atelier et attirer plus de clients, Olawalé sollicite ce microcrédit pour la réalisation de ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Aged 31,  Olawalé is a young single woman who lives in Adidogomé. Olawalé is very dynamic and relies on no-one else to take care of her daily expenses. 

Olawalé sells fabric from well known brands in a shop in the neighbourhood and makes a decent income.  She stocks up at the main market in Lomé twice a month.

Olawalé is seeking this microloan in order to realise her goals, to fit out her own studio and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy 6 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Ridah's Group

texts.en:
Ridah is 33 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Ridah is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Ridah's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Ridah and her group will receive a total of 5 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Veuve et âgée de 51 ans, Abra est  une femme vivant à Ablogomé avec ses deux enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. Pour relever leurs défis de tous les jours, Abra vend des ignames frits et de la patate douce en face d’une école du quartier. Abra s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Gbossimé. Abra demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs d’ignames et réaliser encore plus de bénéfice dans l’exercice de son commerce.
texts.en:
Widowed and aged 51, Abra is a woman living in Ablogomé with her two children for whom she is responsible.  To meet their daily challenges, Abra sells fried yams and sweet potatoes opposite a local school.

Abra stocks up twice a month at the market in Gbossimé. Abra is asking for this loan to buy sacks of yams and make a greater income from running her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 gourds of yams and a sack of sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.en:
Jamilya is 48 years old. She lives with her four children and husband. All of her children are students. Jamila sews traditional women`s dresses. She started her work seven years ago. Her daughter helps her. 

The aim of getting this loan is that Jamilya wants to purchase fabrics, thread and other necessary things for sewing. Because she has to pay for the schooling of her children, she cannot afford to grow her business. Jamilya hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, thread and other necessary things for sewing.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 45 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children, now at their school age. 

Delfina has been engaged in a hog raising activity for 1 year already. She is also getting support from her husband who is an autobody builder and mechanic. 

The couple earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 3 piglets and feeds for her hog raising activity. 

Delfina became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 56 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Cecilia is married with 2 children now at their adult age. 

She earns a living from a snack vending business. She earns approximately Php 1,500 per month from this business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional snacks to sell. Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for almost 12 years. 

In the future, Cecilia hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional snacks to sell.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 67 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 4 children now at their adult age. 

Rodulfo is engaged in rice retailing and snack vending. He’s been doing these businesses for 7 years already. At present, he is also receiving a monthly pension. He earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional 5 sacks of rice and snack ingredients for retail sales. Rodulfo has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years.  

In the future, Rodulfo hopes to expand his rice retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 5 sacks of rice and snack ingredients.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 72 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children, all of whom are now adults. 

Crisanta is engaged in hog raising and rice production activity. She's been in these activities for 12 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional 2 piglets and commercial feeds for her hog raising business. 

Crisanta has been a member of PMPC for almost 13 years. In the future, Crisanta hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 2 piglets and commercial feeds for them.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 48 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents.

Arlyn manages his own convenience store, an eatery and refreshment shop and a lodging house business. 

He's been in these businesses for 15 years already and earns approximately PHP 30,000 each month doing this type of work.

 He said this amount is very helpful in meeting his needs. At the present time, he is also an elected Barangay Official in his community.

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of groceries and consumable products for his existing grocery store and refreshment shop. Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.

In the future, Arlyn hopes to renovate and expand his grocery and refreshment shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of groceries and consumable products.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 54 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children, all now at their adult age and school age. 

Lenie is a babysitter for her grandchild. She is earning support from her husband who is a private employee. The couple earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She is also receiving support from her children. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations. 

She has been a member of PMPC for almost 9 years. In the future, Lenie hopes to engage in a retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 56 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Glenda has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Concepta's Group

texts.en:
Concepta is a 30-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Concepta has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Concepta described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Concepta’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Ten years ago Judith started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Sosiot, a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a better time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Judith believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Judith waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana de 34 años de edad, ella está casada y tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo y día a día luchan para sacar su hogar adelante y poder superar la adversidad.

Ella es panadera, desde hace mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a este oficio desde su juventud, a ella le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que gracias a ello ha sido capaz de mantener a su familia.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para la elaboración de pan y así ampliar su negocio, de esta forma podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.

Ella sueña seguir trabajando para que su negocio sea rentable y cumplir todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 34 years old, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband, and every day they strive to move their household ahead and be able to overcome adversity.

She is a baker. She has worked at this trade for a long time, since her youth. She likes her work a lot, since thanks to it she has been able to support her family.

She needs the loan to buy ingredients to make bread and thus expand her business. In this way she will be able to enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

She dreams of continuing to work so that her business will be profitable and accomplishing all her goals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread and thus expand her business

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Everlyne will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Everlyne plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Everlyne’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant 9.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Simiyu's Group

texts.en:
Simiyu, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Simiyu will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. Simiyu plans to use the profits he gains this year to rent more land to cultivate.

In total, Simiyu’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant 9.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Rehana Kousar

texts.en: Rehana kousar is 37 years old and an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, who has run a tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years. He is the family's sole breadwinner, and needs to buy different types of tailoring supplies, such as cloth, needles and sewing machine accessories. Due to financial constraints, he is not able to buy these items for his business. Therefore Rehana kousar has applied for Kiva loan from our field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband fulfill his business needs so that he can earn more income. For this financial assistance Rehana kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy millet, beans, peanuts and their products to resell

loans.name: María Xenia

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo y juntos luchan y trabajan por salir delante día a día y mantener su hogar. 

María se ha dedicado a la labor de ser ordenanza, ella cuenta que lleva mucho tiempo trabajando en ese oficio, ella se siente muy a gusto en su trabajo pues se lleva muy bien con sus compañeros y le gusta lo que hace, además que gracias a ello puede mantener su hogar y cubrir sus necesidades.  

Ella desea utilizar el crédito para comprar materiales y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que desea que su casa se vea bonita y lo más importante mejorar su estructura para que resista mucho mejor al clima.

Ella planea continuar trabajando y seguir adelante con su familia, mejorar sus ingresos para poder tener una jubilación plena y poder disfrutarla con sus hijos y su querido esposo.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 50 years old, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband, and together they strive and work day after day to get ahead and to maintain their household.

Maria does the work of an office assistant. She relates that she has been working in this job for a long time. She feels very comfortable in her work, since she gets along well with her fellow workers and she likes what she does. In addition, thanks to her work, she can maintain their household and cover their needs.

She wants to use the loan to buy materials and improve the conditions of their home, since she wants their house to be nice and, most importantly, to improve its structure so that it can better resist the weather.

She plans to continue working, continue forward with her family, and improve their income in order to be able to have a full retirement and enjoy it with their children and her beloved husband.

loans.use: to buy materials and improve the conditions of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a roof on her house, since winter is coming and she wants to be secure.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 45 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse is a tricycle operator, while she manages a store for income. 

She is selling grocery items, and wanted to earn good profits for her children's education. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell in her store. 

She hopes to build sales and profits to save funds for emergency and educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy sof tdrinks, canned goods, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Moldokadyr

texts.ru: Молдокадыр, 60 лет, женат, 5 детей. У него среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Сын активно помогает по хозяйству. В хозяйстве Молдокадыра на сегодняшний день есть: 3 коровы, 10 овец, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 3,0 ГА, он выращивает ячмень и клевер. Ежемесячный доход Молдокадыр составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения объемов продажи экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Молдокадыра и его семьи и купить сельскохозяйственную технику.
texts.en: Moldokadyr is 60, married, and has five children. He has a secondary education and has raised livestock and planted crops for a long time. His son actively helps him around the farm. Moldokadyr currently has three cows, ten sheep, and a 3.0 hectare plot of land where he grows barley and clover. His monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). In order to expand his business, he applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows and increase organic milk sales. The profits from the business will help Moldokadyr and his family to improve their living conditions and purchase agricultural machinery.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Adalila

texts.es: Doña Adalila solicito su primer crédito para poder comprar los insumos adecuados como fertilizantes, abonos, foliares y demás para poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café pagando al mismo tiempo la mano de obra con la cual sus cultivos de café dieron un resultado satisfactorio, un grano de café con buen peso, con el tamaño correcto el cual fue vendido a un buen precio a comparación con el año pasado. En esta nueva oportunidad ella solicita un nuevo crédito para nueva mente poder cumplir con la asistencia técnica en esta temporada, el palo de café está floreciendo y es el punto exacto para poder aplicar los diferentes abonos y fertilizantes evitando de esta manera plagas y que la flor sea débil esperando ser apoyada nuevamente.
texts.en: Doña Adalila applied for her first loan to buy the necessary materials such as fertilizers, manure, foliar products, and others to care for her coffee crops. She also paid for labor costs,  which consequently helped her coffee crops had satisfactory results. The coffee grain had good weight and had the right size, allowing her to sell at a good price compared to the previous year. This time, she is asking for a new loan to be able to meet the technical needs once again this season. The coffee stick is blooming, and it is the perfect time to apply fertilizers and manures, to avoid plagues which weaken the blooms. She hopes to get your support once again.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor costs to attend her coffee crops

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 65 years old and has ten children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Patrick has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Patrick also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about since it will allow him to have light during dark hours, so his children will be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Patrick's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Timothy's Group

texts.en:
Timothy is 26 years old and often described as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Webuye District, formed by 11 farmers, including himself.

Timothy has been a farmer for five years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2010 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He has decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

With this loan, Timothy’s Group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Benson is 32 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has two children and is married. As a group leader, Benson is representing his group of 12 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Benson's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

Benson and his group will receive a total of 4 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Yanet Maria

texts.es:
Yanet es una mujer muy juiciosa, pulida, cuidadosa, dedica al mundo de las confecciones, a sus 45 años de edad mantiene su hogar sola sin ayuda a su hijo, con criterio y temperamento, dado que al separarse de su esposo ejerció el papel tierno de una madre y la rectitud de un padre.
 Apoyar a esta empresaria es apoyar a mujeres independientes que no desistieron a su idea de progreso aún ante la ausencia de su marido, salieron solas adelante y quieren más, por ejemplo Yanet quiere una casa propia, pagarle la educación a sus hijos, tener un taller de confección lleno de empleadas y no desiste de estas ideas pues sabe que este será su futuro.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una maquina fileteadora, hilos, botones y broches para sus prendas.
texts.en: Yanet is a very wise, polished, and careful woman, dedicated to the tailoring world. At 45 years of age, she manages her home alone with her son, with good judgement and temperament. When she separated from her husband, she had to handle the tender role of a mother and the righteousness of a father. To support this business woman is to support independent women who didn't give up their idea of progress,  even in the absence of their husbands. They get ahead by themselves and they want more. For example, Yanet wants her own home, to pay for her children's education, to have a sewing shop full of employees, and she will not give up these ideas because she knows that this will be her future. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing fillet machine, threads, buttons, and clasps for her garments.

loans.use: To buy a sewing fillet machine, threads, buttons, clasps, to build up her sewing shop.

loans.name: Jarmenson Miguel

texts.es:
Jamerson desde temprana horas de la madruga se encuentra despierto, trabajando en su panadería para tener pan fresco a primera hora del día, este muchacho de 36 años de edad es feliz realizando su profesión y con ella genera el sustento para su pareja, y dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad. 
En la foto se puede apreciar el local del señor Jamerson, pero tiene una gran complicación y es que no cumple con las normas sanitarias de espacio que se requieren y por esta razón las entidades regulatorias están dispuestos a cerrarle el negocio si en un tiempo determinado no hace las respectivas modificaciones.
Jamerson quiere pedirle de manera formal pero muy necesitado un apoyo para tener el capital suficiente para realizar las reformas locativos y mitigar el riesgo de cierre por partes de las entidades regulatorias.
texts.en:
Jamerson is awake from the early hours of the morning, working in his bakery to have fresh bread at the first hours of the day. This guy, 36 years old, is happy doing his profession and, with it, generates sustenance for his partner and two children ages 10 and 12.

In the photo, one can appreciate Jamerson's space, but it has a big problem and it is that it doesn't comply with the health codes which are necessary for the space and, for this reason, the regulatory agencies are ready to close the business if he doesn't do the needed changes within a set time.

Jamerson wants to ask you formally but urgently for support to have the sufficient capital to make the changes to his space and mitigate the risk of closure by the regulatory agencies.

loans.use: to make some changes to the space, to meet code and avoid being closed by the regulatory agency.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, desde hace varios años  se dedica al comercio, vive con su compañero de vida y tiene cuatro hijos q ya no viven con ella pues son independientes.

María trabaja duramente día con día, desde su juventud se ha dedicado al negocio informal (venta de golosinas.) así logró sacar adelante  a sus hijos q  el día  de  hoy son personas  de  bien.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos y pagar  mano de obra para construir un muro en su casa.

María anhela seguir mejorando su casa  y con esta  ayuda  q ella obtendrá del crédito   
logrará mejorar su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 43 years old, is a determined woman. She has run a store  for several years.

She lives with her life companion, and she has 4 children that don´t live with her anymore, because they are independent.

Maria works hard every day. Since  she was young, she has had a casual business (selling candy). This is how she was able to support her children, who are good people nowadays.

She needs the loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, and to pay for the labor to build a wall in her house.

 Maria hopes to keep improving her house, and with this help from the loan, she'll be able to increase her assets.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and to pay for the labor to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 37-year-old woman, from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She has three family members and is the only person who generates income on her own to make financial stability for the family. Lia works as a translator and also gets a small income from rent. She finds it hard to lead the family effectively and to cover all expenses. She requires another source of income. 

Lia requested a loan from local financial institutions and her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start up program gives people chance to start or re-start businesses.  Lia plans to start profitable work and set up a poultry farm. She will purchase a special race of chickens, will breed them, and sell them for good prices at the local market. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Lia, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased with regards to Kiva lenders. Lia will be very grateful for the help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to set up a poultry farm to get business income.

loans.name: Affousatou

texts.fr: Affousatou est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans et vit à Gblinkomé avec ses trois enfants. Pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, Affousatou vend des emballages pour gagner la rentabilité nécessaire pour son commerce. Affousatou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois à Accra pour acheter ses emballages. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants, Affousatou demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Affousatou is a married woman, aged 33 and who lives in Gblinkomé with her three children.  To meet her family expenses, Affousatou sells wrapping paper to achieve the necessary profitability of her business.  Affousatou stocks up twice a month in Accra, buying her wrapping paper.

Affousatou is requesting this loan to achieve her objectives, to have a substantial stock and maximise her profit to help her husband with the costs of education of their children.

loans.use: to buy 12 packs of wrapping paper

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
William is 31 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has one child and is married. As a group leader, William is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of William's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

William and his group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of eight acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 35 years old and a married mother of five children, and often described as a very trustworthy person. 

Although Margaret has been a farmer for 15 years, she is new to One Acre Fund. She decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Margaret wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Margaret hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights, and even though Margaret decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 66 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult age. Florita earns a living from dressmaking and from their fishing activity. She's been in the business for more than 20 years. 

She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business. Florita has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house finishing. She has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Florita hopes to expand her fishing business by acquiring additional fishing boats.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house finishing.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Leonida is separated with three children, who are now school age. 

Leonida earns a living from coconut buying and trading. She's been engaged in this business for almost 20 years already.  She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity, and the said amount is so helpful to support the needs of her family. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and retrading. Leonida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leonida hopes to expand her copra retrading business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts for copra processing and retrading.

loans.name: Jakelin

texts.en:
Jakelin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Jakelin has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 45-year-old farmer in Lessos village, located in the Eldoret region of Kenya. She owns a 1-acre farm on which they keep cows, poultry, and grow maize. Priscilla also runs a small business supplying cereals to consumers. Priscilla is seeking a loan to restock her cereal store. 

She is going to sell the cereal seeds in a better market, at a higher price than she paid for them; the greater her supply, the greater her profit. With your money, Priscilla will be able to purchase enough cereals to recover all of her costs once she sells them. The money will go toward her family's expenses and children's education. The income she makes from this business will also enable her to make loan repayments as scheduled. Her hope is to keep improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Ana has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 45 years old, married and has one child in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Mary Ann has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 60 years old with five children. Araceli works very hard to provide for them.

Araceli runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.  Araceli has been in this business for nine years now. 

In the future, Araceli would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Melany

texts.en:
Melany is 34 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, coffee, sugar, milk, bread, juice, soft-drinks, etc.

Melany has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending. Melany aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, coffee, sugar, mlik, bread, juice, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Marina Abigail

texts.es:
Marina, tiene una oferta para mejorar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para concretizarla y requiere de un nuevo capital para comprar una vaca parida y concentrado para alimentar todo su ganado, de esta manera incrementara su inventario.
Con la inversión anterior sus cosechas están siendo más abundantes y la ganadería esta mejor establecida, su familia se mantiene muy unida y le brinda el apoyo necesario para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Marina has an offer to improve her business, but she does not have the capital necessary to follow through with it. She needs another loan in order to buy a calf as well as food to feed the rest of her livestock. In this way, she will increase her inventory. 

With her previous loan, she was able to make her harvest more abundant and establish her livestock business. Her family is still very close and supports her as she continues working.

loans.use: to buy a calf and food to feed all of her livestock. This will help her to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en:
Edina is 28 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Edina has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Edina also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Edina's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet is a 58-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, is often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Janet has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming training.

Janet described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Janet’s Group will be able to plant a total of five and three quarters acres of land, and purchase a total of six solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 47 years old, married, and has four children who are studying. She manages a store selling foods, snacks, soft drinks and canned goods. Her spouse is a jeepney driver. 

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy more goods to sell.  She will buy soft drinks, eggs, canned goods and noodles. This will help increase sales capacity and someday achieve financial stability. Additional revenue will help sustain educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy many plastic bags for resale so as to earn more.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family. She has a bakeshop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Arlene is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakeshop business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakeshop business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 68 years old and married with three children. Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like rice, eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..  Carmen has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like rice, eggs, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Segundo

texts.es:
Gracias a clases y capacitaciones el señor Oscar se convirtió en un experto reparador de electrodomésticos, una actividad que realiza desde el año 2005 y con la cual ha mantenido su familia conformada por 3 hijos, y su actual pareja pues legalmente es un hombre separado.
La razón que trae el señor Oscar ante ustedes son los avances tecnológicos que obligan a cambiar herramientas y comprar repuestos que se acomoden a los artilugios y objetos tecnológicos que hay hoy en día.
Oscar venía trabajando con los repuestos tradicionales pero ya solo tiene trabajos para reparar televisores leds y equipos de sonidos más actuales y este es el motivo que lo lleva a solicitar un crédito uno para comprar herramienta para tratar estos equipos y lo otro comprar repuestos para repararlos.
La necesidad es muy latente pues al comprarlos en cantidad tendrá mayor utilidad y existencias para atender eventualidades a domicilio.
texts.en:
Thanks to classes and training Oscar has become an expert appliance repair-person. He has been doing this business since 2005 and he has supported his family which is made up of his 3 children and his current partner as legally he is separated. The reason that brings Oscar to you are the advances in technology that oblige him to change tools and buy parts that accommodate the gadgets and tech objects that exist today.

Oscar has been working with traditional replacement parts but now he only has work fixing LED TV sets and more modern sound systems. And this is his motive in requesting a loan to buy tools to work on these machines and buy spare parts to repair them. The need is smoldering since buying them in quantity will bring more profit and he can stock them to care for contingencies at home.

loans.use: to buy tools and more modern replacement parts as times change and he's getting left behind.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 22 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Elizabeth is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Elizabeth's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate.

Elizabeth and her group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Julian Gregorio

texts.es:
Julián es un joven de 25 años de edad que con su venta de productos de uso y consumo personal sostiene sus estudios, es muy responsable y comprometido es tanto el empeño que pone en sus actividades que para vender realiza largos desplazamientos pero eso no importa con tal de generar recursos para transportarse a su universidad, pagar sus libros, copias, su matrícula, su alimento, esto lo tiene muy feliz y quiere seguir con este proyecto aspira a tener un local, una persona vendiendo y que juntos salgan adelante.
Con la ayuda de un préstamo Julián quiere capitalizar su negocio, cubrir algunas perdidas, y seguir con su labor, comprando artículos de cuidado capilar, facial, para el cuerpo y el hogar.
texts.en:
Julián, age 25, keeps up his studies with his sale of personal use and consumption products.  He is very responsible and committed.  He puts forth so much effort in his business activities that he makes long trips in order to sell.  However, this is not important in that he generates resources for transportation to his university and pays for his book, copies, registration, and food.  This makes him very happy, and he wants to continue with this project.  He aspires to have a place and another person selling, and together they will get ahead.

With the help of a loan Julián want to capitalize his business, cover some losses, and continue with his work.  He will buy products for hair, facial, and body care and products for care of the household.

loans.use: to buy stock of domestic use products.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan tiene 60 años de edad, está casao y tiene tres hijos los cuales se encuentrane estudiando.

Juan es un hombre trabajador, él se dedica a la agricultura pues fue lo que le enseñaron sus padres desde muy pequeño, y lo mismo ha hecho Juan con sus hijos, enseñarles dicho trabajo. Además posee unas vacas que él cuida y que le proveen leche.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y frijol para comercializar.

Él sueña con obtener ganancia de los granos básicos y seguir dando educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is 60 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. He is a hardworking man who works in agriculture. Juan learned the trade from his parents when he was very young. In return, he taught his children how to do this type of work. In addition, he cares for milk-producing cows that he owns.

Juan needs a loan to buy corn and beans that he can sell. He dreams of generating income from these basic staples so that he can continue to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans that he can sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a male Ugandan aged 29 years.  He is married to Violet, and they have four children ages nine, six, four and one, and only two attend school.

Christopher is a farmer who grows cassava, but he has also has also been teaching in order to supplement his income.  He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy a motorcycle for commercial motorcycle transport purposes.

His dream for the future is to acquire more land and educate his children up to university level, but he says he is challenged by weather changes such as droughts and heavy rains, which affect his yields and income. 

He appreciates the services of the Kiva lenders and UGAFODE as an institution.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Gjete

texts.en:
Gjete wants to add a milk cow to the existing herd of two other cows with most of his loan and with the rest, pay some debts. He is a 51-year-old villager and married father of four. 

For the past almost five years, he’s been in the livestock activity, selling raw milk and two calves per year. He also owns two dynym of agricultural land where he plants only feed for his animals which is not enough and he buys some from others. In the house yard, he plants veggies for family use. 

Gjete has been working in the neighbor country of Montenegro as well, where he earns about 200 EUR per month. His wife has had two surgeries very recently and receives some monthly assistance of about $32/month.

loans.use: to add a milk cow to the existing herd of two and pay some debts

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 30 years old, is married with six children who are her dependents. They are living in Tbeng Meanchey district of Preah Vihear Province. To support the family, Sopheap has been growing mung beans and soybeans for the last six years. She can earn around 11 USD a day. 

Counting this time, Sopheap has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for three cycles. She is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy bean seeds, and to hire workers to plough and take care of the plantation. She hopes that her family condition will be improved, continuing to send her children to school, and being well fed.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, and to hire workers to plough and take care of the plantation.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Velima's Group

texts.en:
Velima is 49 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader, and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Velima has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Velima also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Velima's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 11.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: 030306040001.thiệu Lý Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh is 64 years old and she is married with three children. Thanh is the group leader of the 030306040001.thiệu Lý solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thanh works in agriculture raising poultry. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2015, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thanh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is a 43-year-old single lady who started working as a baker fifteen years ago to cover her needs and expenses. She learned baking from her mother a long time ago. Thus she gained professional skills in this domain. She bakes " Markook" which is a type of flatbread baked on a domed or convex metal griddle, known as "Saj."

Samaher is a hard working and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business, so she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a baking oven which will help her start baking the Lebanese whole wheat bread (Mishtah). This loan will help Samaher satisfy her customers' special needs. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a baking oven to start baking Lebanese whole wheat bread (Mishtah)

loans.name: 030309010002.thiệu Lý Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh is 56 years old and she is married with two children. Thanh is the group leader of the 030309010002.thiệu Lý solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thanh works in agriculture raising poultry. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2015, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thanh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 6, Trung Phú, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hường is 51 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 6, Trung Phú, Yên Mỹ solidarity group. 

Hường works in agriculture raising poultry. Hường has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2012, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hường has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hường faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hường hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell like shampoo, Pampers, groceries, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 30 years now. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional item to sell like shampoo, Pampers, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jhon James

texts.es:
La seguridad en el sector de turbo es un tema muy delicado, los negocios tiene que tener sus medidas de seguridad apropiadas para evitar robos.
Como se puede ver en la foto Jhon un hombre que se dedica al comercio de indumentaria para hombre y mujer tiene sus propias medidas y es que ha sido víctima de robo los cuales le generan pérdidas que frenan su progreso.
Pero su principal dificultad son los lagos desplazamientos hasta sus proveedores pues son de Medellín.
A pesar de tanto inconveniente Jhon sigue fiel a su negocio que le da de comer a él y su familia conformada por su pareja y un pequeño de 1 años de edad.
 Con la ayuda de un crédito quiere renovar su tienda invirtiendo en ropa para dama y caballero y una línea infantil.
Con este crédito busca atraer más clientes que ladrones proyectando su negocio a ser como las mejores tiendas de la ciudad de Medellín que es su gran propósito.
texts.en:
Security in the neighborhood of Turbo is a sensitive topic. Businesses must take appropriate security measures in order to prevent theft. As shown in the photo, Jhon is a gentleman who sells clothes for men and women on his own. He has been the victim of theft, which has resulted in losses that have slowed down his progress. However, his main difficulty are the long trips he must make in order to meet vendors in Medellín. Despite this inconvenience, Jhon continues to persevere with his business since it allows him to feed himself and his family, which includes his partner and their one-year-old child.

With the help of this loan, Jhon wants to restock his store with women’s and men’s clothing, as well as a line of children’s outfits. He hopes to use this loan to attract more customers, rather than thieves. His ultimate plan is to make his business stand out as one of the best shops in the city of Medellín.

loans.use: to restock his shop with clothes for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, biscuits, groceries, etc..

Maria has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, biscuits, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dairo Elias

texts.es:
Dairo es un productor agrícola soltero que se vale solo de sus habilidades para generar sus propios recursos, que busca mejorar sus condiciones de vida a partir de mucho trabajo honesto, aprendiendo nuevas formas de cultivar y mantener las tierras.
En el momento Dairo tiene una necesidad latente para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos es por esto que recurre a la ayuda de ustedes para comprar algunos implementos que necesita, la razón del préstamo es que los insumos agrícolas tiene un precio muy elevado, con el préstamo quiere comprar primeramente una motobomba, riegos, abonos, semillas, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas entre otros exterminadores.
texts.en:
Dairo is an agricultural producer.  He is single, and he takes care of himself solely by his skill at generating his own resources.  He is looking to improve his living conditions by a lot of honest work, learning new ways of cultivation, and maintaining the land.

Dairo now has an underlying need to sustain his crops.  That is why he turns to your help to buy some items that he needs.  The reason for the loan is that the price of agricultural supplies is very high.  He wants to use the loan to primarily buy a water pump, irrigation, fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides, among other exterminators.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, irrigation, fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides, among other exterminators.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Lilian. She is a 37-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Nyamira, which is a small rural town in the Nyanza region of Kenya. Lilian and her husband have been blessed with three children. For sixteen years, Lilian has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. 

Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, and the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth can do her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Lilian, however, is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
A resident of Ro Veang district of Preah Vihear province, Sokhon is 26 years of age and married, with two young children that have not started school. 

Her main sources of incomes are from a cassava plantation and rice farming. She has been doing it for 16 years and it earns her 5 USD a day. This is her fourth time being a client of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to repair her house and to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation. She hopes that her family will have a higher standard of living and that her children can continue their study.

loans.use: to repair her house and to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel is 65 years old and is often referred to as a really trustworthy person. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Webuye District, formed by 8 farmers, including himself.

Daniel has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2010 because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also two solar lights in order to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

With this loan, Daniel’s Group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Sakhut

texts.en:
Sakhut is from the Ro Veang district of Preah Vihea province.  She is 36 years old and married with four children. Three of the children are attending school, while another one is under the age of 6. 

To finance the family budget, Sakhut and her husband have been planting cassava and farming rice for 16 years. They manage to earn around 8 USD daily. Sakhut has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for seven cycles. She is pursuing a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her plantation. 

She hopes that her family will be better fed and that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava stems

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Orfa Nidia

texts.es:
Ella es Orfa una joven muy enérgica de 28 años de edad, criada y formada con las buenas costumbres del campo, trabajadora, paciente, amante del campo y de los animales.
Su actividad principal es la cría de ganado, y es una proveedora importante para los lecheros pues les vende los terneros para producir la leche.
Su trabajo consiste en comprar terneros recién nacidos alimentarlos, engordarlos y posteriormente venderlo, una actividad que aprendió de su familia. 
Solicita un préstamo para seguir con el flujo de su actividad, con el préstamo ajustara para la compra de terneros, y realizar las actividades.
texts.en: Orfa  is an energetic 28 year old raised and educated with good customs from the country. She is hard-working, patient, a lover of the country and of animals. Her main activity is raising cattle as she is an important supplier for the milk producers as she sells them the calves to produce milk. Her work is buying recently born calves, feeding them, fattening and later selling them. She learned this trade from her family. She is requesting a loan to continue withe the course of her business. With the loan she will arrange to buy calves and do her business.

loans.use: to buy recently born calves, with the loan she will arrange to buy 4 specimens.

loans.name: Caro's Group

texts.en:
Caro, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Caro will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Caro plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Caro’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of ten acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
28-year-old Sambath is married with two little children who are under the age of 6. They all are living in a remote village of Chey Sen district of Preah Vihear province. 

Her only source of income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for the last 10 years. She manages to earn 5 USD each day. 

Sambath is a new member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking for a loan of KHR 1,400,000 to buy a tractor to plough the rice field. She hopes that her family will be able to afford to send her children to school and provide them a better life.

loans.use: to buy a tractor to plough the rice field

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chey Sen District

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen is the group leader of his group in Webuye District, and he is representing 11 farmers, including himself. Stephen joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for four years.

Like many other farmers, Stephen decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will buy with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

Stephen's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 5.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Fitim

texts.en:
Fitim is 31 years old and the father of four children between the ages of 1 and 7 years old. Currently, his oldest child is the only one attending school so his wife stays home to care for the children and the home. In the small village where they live, it is common for people to be involved in agriculture in order to make a living.

Fitim is the main source of income and generates his by planting corn and wheat to use and sell. He also works on the land of others for a fee. He is very busy all day with his work so that he can give to his children whatever they need and a better education and life. Fitim is requesting a loan in order to buy artificial guano. He promises to pay on time and thanks all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy artificial guano

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
42 years of age, Lorn is a villager of Chey Sen District of Preah Vihea Province. She is married with three children in school. 

She has been a rice farmer for 24 years in order to maintain the family finance. She is able to earn around 5.00 USD per day. This is Lorn's third loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy a tractor to plough her rice field. 

The profit from her rice farm will be spent on her children's education and the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a tractor to plough her rice field.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chey Sen District

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda is a 41-year-old divorced Syrian mother of four children. She has been working as a hairdresser and selling clothes from her house for twenty years to cover her family's needs and expenses. 

She is a hard working and ambitious lady who is the only breadwinner for her beloved kids. Thus she is trying hard to develop her business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to legally register her car which will facilitate her work and help her transport her products.

Warda hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to legally register her car which will help her transport her products

loans.name: Evarlyne's Group

texts.en:
Evarlyne is 42 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Evarlyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Evarlyne also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Evarlyne's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 20 years old and has one child in school.

Maria has a buy and sell gravel and sand business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment for her gravel and sand business.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her gravel and sand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a green house

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Alice, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children, known by her community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Alice joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Alice plans to send her children to school.

Among the 12 farmers in Alice's Group, a total of 5.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 49 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, and to purchase a solar light

loans.name: Halime

texts.en:
Halime wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan. She was very pleased with the first loan and the results. She was able to use the loan in order to renovate her milk storage facility where she would keep the milk she collected, enabling her to prevent spoiling or decay for a longer period of time. Having this benefit meant she was able to see an increase in her profits and a decrease in her losses.

Halime loves working in agriculture and on her farm. She is requesting a second loan in order to purchase artificial guano to plant wheat and corn to sell, and to renovate her stable.

She hopes that in the near future, she will be able to expand her farm even more and be able to continue to sell even more milk, dairy products, and other grains and vegetables. She is very grateful for the continued support and thankful for the opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase artificial guano to plant wheat and corn to sell, and to renovate her stable.

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
A single man, Bunthoeun is 28 years old and living in a rural village of Krok Lanh district of Siem Reap province. He has been a rice farmer for ten years. For the last three years, he has been going to work in Thailand as a paid worker. His daily income is 5 USD.

This is the fourth loan that Bunthoeun has had with Kiva’s partner (VisionFund). He is a creditable client, since he has successfully repaid all the loans on time.

He is looking for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to repair his kitchen. He hopes to have a better living space to assist his daily activities.

loans.use: to repair his kitchen.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Nhieb

texts.en:
A villager of Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province, Nhieb is a 54-year-old married man with two children. 

He has been a truck driver for 20 years in order to support the family. He has also gone to work in Thailand as paid-worker. He is able to earn just above 3 USD per day. 

Nhieb has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, once before. Now he is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to repair his house. He believes he will feel safer and healthier with a newly repaired house.

loans.use: to repair his house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marlita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling gravel and sand in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Marlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy equipment for her gravel and sand business. She successfully repaid her most recent loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Marlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her gravel and sand business.

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Anunciacion is a married woman with six children. Anunciacion is 32 years old and has five children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anunciacion has a direct selling personal use business in the Philippines. Anunciacion has been in this business for one year.

Anunciacion requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products to sell such as soap, etc.

In the future, Anunciacion would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell such as soap, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 56 years old now.

Milagros has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy equipment for the maintenance of her business. Milagros has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 49 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nancy has been in this business for 26 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wilkister's Group

texts.en:
Wilkister is 57 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Wilkister has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.
