Wilkister also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Wilkister's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Wilber Arbey

texts.es:
Este hombre de 33 años de edad llamado Wilber es todo un campeón, sobrevivió al frio de la calle, a diferentes adversidades que el destino puso en su contra, pero con humildad y trabajo, apoyándose en su familia fue slaiendo de estas adversidades.
Vive junto con su esposa y dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad y fueron ellos los que le dieron las fuerzas para salir adelante, levantarse del barro y consolidar un negocio informal de venta de gafas y estuches de gafas ubicado en el centro de Medellín.
Dicho negocio le ha permitido generar el alimento en su hogar, y ahora tiene sueños, de comprar vivienda, de pagar la educación de sus hijos de que las cosas pueden ser mejor.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido variado de gafas, estuches ya que sus venta está aumentando debido a la ola de calor que pasa Medellín
texts.en:
This is Wilber, a 33-year-old man who is in many ways a champion. He survived the cold of the street and the different adversities that fate set against him, all with humbleness and hard work, supporting his family whilst leaving these adversities behind.

He lives with his wife and two children who are 9 and 12 years of age. They were the ones who gave him the strength to get through, lift himself out of the mud and set up an informal business selling sunglasses and cases for sunglasses in the centre of Medellín.

This business has allowed him to provide food for his household, and now he dreams of buying a house, of paying for his children to be educated, of things being better.

He is asking for a loan to buy an assorted range of sunglasses and cases, as his sales are improving thanks to the heat wave that Medellín is experiencing.

loans.use: , an admirable man who has survived through much adversary, to sell sunglasses and cases for sunglasses

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 54 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 1 year now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc..

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional item to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kamagut village, situated in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Land in Kamagut is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Kamagut practice agriculture. Esther, and her husband, own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their lovely children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk.

Esther is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale. As her children grow older, their upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Esther needs to boost her cereal selling business. With your loan, she will be able to sell her cereals to both her neighbours and the local market. She will use the additional income from cereal sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees. All she waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 21 years old now.

Rosalyn has a business direct-selling personal products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional product to sell like lotion, etc. Rosalyn has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like lotion, etc.

loans.name: Pot

texts.en:
44 years of age, Pot is a resident of a rural village in Siem Reap province. She is married and has three children. They are her dependents.

Pot's primary source of income is from being a paid worker for 2 years, in Thailand, while her husband has been a solider for 10 years. They also raise livestock at home to sell. The family daily income is about 5 USD.

As a new client of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, Pot is requesting a loan of 200,000 KHR to repair her toilet.

loans.use: repair her toilet

loans.name: Davide

texts.en: Davide is 56 years old and a mother to seven children. For the past eight years, she has been buying and reselling used clothes. She is from a little town in northern Albania where poverty is an issue, thus the used items are favorites for the locals. Her husband receives a disability income of about $210 per month, and she also receives a disability income of $113 per month. (Prior to the current location, they lived in a more remote village with very cold weather and with no lands at all where they could plant. There was a copper plant, the only one in the country. The raw copper came from two mines located in the Albanian Alps where political prisoners worked under terrible conditions during the communist era with the majority of them dying at a very young age.) This loan will help Davide stock up on thrift items inventory.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory of thrift items to resell

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is 31 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Mehwish has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Chronic lives in a rural village in the Soni Kom district of Siem Reap province. She is 49 years old, a wife and mother of nine. Two of  her children are still her dependents. Her main source of income is from rice farming. Her children are also helping out with the family budget as paid workers in Thailand. As a new member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, Chhon is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy soil to fill her yard to prevent it from being flooded during the rainy season. She hopes that her family will be safer from flood if their land is higher.

loans.use: to buy soil to fill her yard to prevent flooding during the rainy season

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. He is 70 years old, is married and has ten children.

Joseph likes to think of himself as a very trustworthy person. He has been working with One Acre Fund since 2012, and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Joseph plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a goat.

In total, Joseph’s Group will receive farm supplies to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer in order to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toilet seats and a smaller-sized poly tank for her commercial toilet facility.

loans.name: Makara

texts.en:
Makara is a 23-year-old single student who is studying electronic engineering, in his third year at an institute in the city. He is from Kandal province in Cambodia. His father is a security guard and his mother earns income from selling small fruit trees and flowers. 

Makara is requesting a loan and he will use it to pay his university fees from the third to the fifth year. This loan will help him earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he wants a good job with a decent salary to help his parents.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rowela

texts.en:
Rowela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 27 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Rowela has a business direct-selling personal products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell like deodorant, etc. Rowela has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rowela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell like deodorant, etc.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Salvacion has a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of root crops to sell. Salvacion has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of root crops to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Yolanda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell at her business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Suyapa

texts.es:
Blanca de 40 años de edad, ella se crió con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la ganadería, estudió hasta cuarto grado en la escuela pues su situación económica no le permitió continuar, actualmente está casada y tiene dos hijos.

Blanca se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos, además realiza crianza de cerdos en lo cual le ayuda su hijo mayor, ya tiene experiencia de muchos años pues fue la enseñanza que le heredaron sus padres.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar materiales para mejorar su casa, específicamente cemento para repellar las paredes.

Sus sueños son tener una mejor granja de cerdos y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios para que sean profesionales y tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Blanca is 40 years old and was raised by her parents who worked in livestock. She studied up to the 4th grade, but her family's financial situation did not allow her to continue. She is currently married and has two children.

Blanca is a domestic employee and she also raises pigs.  Her eldest son helps her with this. She already has many years of experience raising pigs, and this is the education that her parents passed down to her. 

Blanca is asking for this loan so she can buy materials to fix up her house. Specifically, she will buy cement to plaster the walls.

Her dream is to have a better pig farm and to support her children in their studies so that they will become professionals and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix up her house, specifically cement to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 45 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Shirley works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell at her store, like beverages, canned goods, eggs, condiments, groceries, etc.

Shirley has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell at her store, like beverages, canned goods, eggs, condiments and groceries.

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
James is 42 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

James has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. James also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that James's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
A villager of Pouk district, in Siem Reap province, 54-year-old Pha is a husband and a father of two school-going children. Their main source of income is from their rice farm. He and his wife have been doing rice farming for 36 years. His wife also sells snacks at home to earn a little more. They manage to earn just above 5 USD per day. 

Pha has been with VisionFund, a Kiva partner, for 3 cycles now. He is currently seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to build a toilet. He hopes that with a proper toilet, their family will be less likely to be infected with diseases that come from an unhygienic environment.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 40 years old and a married woman.

The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nasreen has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Benedettah's Group

texts.en:
Benedettah is 45 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Benedettah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Benedettah also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Benedettah's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Chhav

texts.en:
Chhav lives in a small village in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. At 43 years old, Chhav is a married woman with one child. Her main source of income is from selling vegetables, and she has been doing it for three years. She and her husband are also rice farmers and have been for 20 years. Her child also contributes to the family's income by going to Thailand to work as a paid worker. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is borrowing a 1,000,000 KHR loan to repair her toilet. Without a clean and proper toilet, her family tends to be not healthy; therefore, she hopes they will be healthier with the toilet being repaired.

loans.use: to repair her toilet.

loans.name: Sobia Manzoor

texts.en:
Sobia Manzoor is 30-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop, and he is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. 

Sobia Manzoor has been running her own beauty salon for the past six years. She also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the house hold. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hairbrushes and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business. Therefore, Sobia Manzoor has applied for a Kiva loan in a group with other two members. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Sobia Manzoor is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hairbrushes and other accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Naheed Akhtar

texts.en:
Naheed Akhtar is a 28-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for four years. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Naheed Akhtar's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Naheed Akhtar has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Naheed Akhtar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories to increase her husband's business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 33-year-old married woman. She, with her husband, has been doing the work of agriculture for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Bushra has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an extra Poly tank for her water vending business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a buko vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is 33 years old, married and has two young children.

Helen buys and sells “buko” or young coconuts at the market. The young coconut fruit, locally known as buko, is used in some cooking and in making desserts. Helen has been in the business for more than 1 year now, and this is the source of her income.

Helen is asking to take a loan to buy more buko to sell. A loan will help her improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Helen dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more buko to sell

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
39-year-old Phin is a married woman with one child. They are residing in a small rural village of Soni Kom district in Siem Reap province. She has been a rice farmer for 10 years, while her husband has been a construction worker for 5 years in order to finance the family budget. 

Phin is a new client of Kiva partner VisionFund. She is looking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to build a house. She hopes that her family will be happier and healthier with the new house.

loans.use: to build a house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Onesphore

texts.en:
Onesphore is 38 years old. He is married with two children, ages four and seven years old. They both go to school. He has farmed for 18 years and his wife is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell rice.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is 28 years old. He is married with two children aged between 1 and 4 years old. They are still young.

He has farmed for 9 years, while his wife is in a business. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice to sell

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is 28 years old and not yet married. He has been a farmer for five years. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers and to expand his business of farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to grow rice for sale.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon is a resident of Soni Kom district of Siem Reap province. She is 32 years old and married with two young children as her dependents. Her main source of income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for 5 years. Her husband is a construction worker. 

For her first loan with VisionFund, a Kiva partner, Sokhon is seeking 500,000 KHR to buy soil to fill her yard to beautify it. She wants to level the ground to make it look nicer.

loans.use: to buy soil to fill her yard to beautify it.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Thavoeuy

texts.en:
Thavoeuy is a 35-year-old married woman with one daughter who is in secondary school. They are living in a rural village of Pouk district, in Siem Reap province. Thavoeuy has been selling snacks for 1 year, and fruit for 2 years. Her husband has been a blacksmith for 10 years. Together they can earn roughly 5 USD a day. 

This is Thavoeuy's second loan with VisionFund, a Kiva partner, and she is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan to build a toilet for her house. She believes that her family will be healthier if they have a hygienic toilet.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Calixte

texts.en:
Calixte is 42 years old. He is married with three children, between the ages of three and seven years old. They all go to school. 

He has farmed for 21 years and his wife is also a farmer. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice and sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers and improve his standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to grow rice and sell the rice.

loans.name: Leonidha

texts.en:
Leonidha is a married father of two children, nine and six years old, and he is 48 years old. Recently he started to build a house; however, very soon afterwards, he realized that he could not build much, due to the lack of money. He is seen in the house where he only has managed to build some concrete columns with the money he had. 

To earn a living for his family, Leonidha opened up a car washing business about three years back and also has some livestock. He has five goats and sells dairy in the local market. He also has some land, where he has some grapevines and plum and fig orchards, and also plants seasonal vegetables, yet he does not sell any of the latter. He uses them for the family because they are not much according to him.

loans.use: to continue building a house for his family.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 52, is married and living in Ro Veang district, Preah Vihear province. She has four adult children and one young child. They are all her dependents.

For 24 years, her family has been doing rice farming and cassava planting in order to make a living. They manage to earn around 3 USD each day. Yon has successfully repaid all the loans borrowed previously. Now is her sixth time being a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and cassava plantation. She hopes that both plantations will be productive so that she can earn more.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and cassava plantation.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a Ugandan man, aged 40 years, and is married to Patricia, with whom they have four children, ages 17, 15, 13, and nine years old. All of them attend school.

Paul is a businessman who deals in the sale of waragi (local gin), but he also rides boda boda (a passenger bike) to earn extra income.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy waragi for resale to his low income customers. The product has a market since most of the residents cannot afford expensive beer. He anticipates that his profits will be very high since he is buying in bulk using the loan funds.

His dream for the future is to expand his business and acquire more land for farming.

He describes himself as a hardworking person and honest in business. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy waragi (local gin) for resale.

loans.name: Shakeela Bibi

texts.en:
Shakeela Bibi is a 28-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 6 years, and only he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Shakeela Bibi's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories), but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy these above items for his business purposes. Therefore, Shakeela Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories listed above to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income. For this financial assistance, Shakeela Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tailoring accessories

loans.name: Bibi Parveen

texts.en:
Bibi Parveen is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family and he has been running his own book shop for the past ten years. 

Bibi Parveen's husband wants to purchase different types of books for his business, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these books. Therefore, Bibi Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Bibi Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of books for her husband's bookstore.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is married with one child who is two years old and does not yet go to school. Jean Marie Vianney has farmed for 11 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy domestic animals, such as goats and cows, and to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice for sale.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 34 years old. He is married with five children, between the ages of six months and 12 years old. Four of his children go to school. Jean Paul has farmed for 18 years and his wife is also a farmer. 

With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Rany

texts.en: Rany is a 55-year-old widow living in a rural village of Pouk district, in Siem Reap province, with her son. Her son is in primary school. To support the family, Rany has been operating a small grocery store for 20 years. She also has a plot of land for farming, which she has been hiring a worker to work on for 2 years now. She is able to earn 5 USD daily. This is her fourth loan as a member of VisionFund, a Kiva partner. She is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to build a toilet. With the new toilet, she hopes that her family will be healthier.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Residing in Pouk district, in Siem Reap province, Yi is a 42-year-old married woman with one child. Her main source of income is from rice farming, while her husband is a construction worker. The family's other sources of income include raising livestock for sale and growing vegetables. They are able to earn roughly 5 USD every day. 

Yi is borrowing 1,500,000 KHR to repair her house. She has successfully borrowed from VisionFund, a Kiva partner, two times before. She hopes that her family will enjoy a better living space.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 37 years old, is married with six children. Three of the children are her dependents. They are residing in a rural village of Ro Veang district of Preah Vihear province. 

To finance the family, she has been growing rice for 23 years. She can earn 5 USD daily. She has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for five cycles now and she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash and rice seeds for her rice farm. 

She wishes that her rice will produce higher yield.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seeds.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Yenis Mabel

texts.es:
Yenis de 36 años de edad, está soltera y aún no tiene hijos, vive con su madre con quien trabaja duramente para salir adelante.

Yenis se dedica a la sastrería, a la venta de comida los fines de semana, y además a la venta de productos de belleza, su madre le ayuda en el trabajo que realiza y de vez en cuando se dedican a la agricultura.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar el local de sastrería, pues instalará una máquina de confección y necesita tener el lugar en buenas condiciones.

Sus planes son tener un bazar de productos de cosmetología que le genere ganancias suficientes para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yenis, 36, is still single and has no children. She lives with her mother with whom she works hard to get ahead.

Yenis earns her living in tailoring, selling food on the weekends, and the sale of beauty products. Her mother helps in the work she does and also occasionally works in agriculture.

She needs this loan to buy supplies to expand her tailoring shop, to install a machine for sewing, and have the place in good condition. 

Her plans are to have a shop to sell beauty products that will generate enough income for her to get by.

loans.use: to build a workshop for her tailoring business

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Barrio San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer de 48 años de edad es unida de hecho tiene 2 hijos de las edades entre 23 y 27 años vive en Sololá.
Ana María (es la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa gris) esta madre de familia muy entusiasta le gusta trabajar para mantener a su familia, ellas desde hace 15 años se dedica a oficios domésticos trabajando en casas ajenas lavando trastos haciendo limpieza, con esta actividad ella ha podido ayudar a su esposo para mantener a la familia, Ana María es una madre de familia que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia es por eso que quiere remodelar su casa, pero una de las limitaciones que Ana María tiene es que con lo que gana ella y su esposo no les alcanza para realizar esta remodelación  es por eso que se ha unido a un grupo de mujeres con la misma necesidad, para solicitar un prestamo para comprar cemento, bloc y pisos.
El sueño de Ana María es poder conseguir este prestamo para seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana María is a 48-year-old with two children aged 23 and 27 years. They live in Sololá.

Ana María (the first on the left side in the photo with a gray blouse) is a very enthusiastic mother who likes to work to support her family including the 15 years she worked as a maid, washing dishes, and cleaning. With this job, she could help her husband support the family. Ana María is a mother who cares about the welfare of her family so she wants to remodel their home. One of the limitations Ana María has is that she cannot afford to do this remodeling with what she and her husband earns so she joined a group of women with the same need to apply for a loan to buy cement, blocks, and flooring.

Ana María’s dream is to get this loan and continue to make home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase materials for home improvements

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional biscuits, dried fish, charcoal and rice, which were needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

Filipina is very positive that she could improve her business if you will lend her an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buy additional stock of dried fish, biscuits, charcoal and sacks of rice. Her customers are likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Filipina aims to give her family a better life in the coming years. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of dried fish, biscuits, charcoal, and rice needed for her business.

loans.name: Edit Del Rosario

texts.es:
Edit  de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ella y está estudiando 8° grado pues los demás ya están casados y viven aparte.


       Edit se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella sale a los cantones a vender, tiene unos 16 años de ser comerciante, además de este negocio también vende mariscos pues ya tiene clientes que no quiere dejarlos sin darles atención, su esposo sale con ella a vender pues siempre le ayuda con el trabajo para salir adelante.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar lámina, madera, cemento, ladrillos para mejorar su casa.

Su sueño es construir su casa y darle estudio a su hija ya que ella quiere ser enfermera por lo que está dispuesta a cumplir los sueños de su hija también.
texts.en:
Edit, age 51, studied up through 2nd grade of primary school.  She is married, and her husband is a farmer.  She has three children.  Only one of them lives with her and is in the 8th grade.  The others are already married and live separately from her.

Edit works selling clothing.  She goes out to the rural communities to sell.  She has been a businesswoman for 16 years.  In addition to this business, she sells shellfish, since she already has customers whom she doesn’t want to leave without giving them service.  Her husband goes with her to sell.  He always helps her with the work so they can get ahead.

She needs the loan to buy metal sheets, wood, cement, and bricks to improve her house.

Her dream is to build her house and send her daughter to school, since she wants to be a nurse.  Therefore, Edit wants to fulfill her daughter’s dreams too.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, cement, and bricks to improve her house.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
49-year-old Men is residing in a rural village of Ro Veang District, Preah Vihear Province. She is married with one child. 

Men has been a rice farmer supporting her family's financial budget. She has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for a total of 9 cycles including the present one. She has already repaid all of her previous loans. 

Men is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes that her rice will have a high yield so that she can have more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. 

In order to support her husband to take care of their family, Kaneez began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

Kaneez has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for women and children as well as silver jewelry in order to start her business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna Isabel es una señora de 41 años que habita en el caserío Los Limones del municipio de El Sauce donde nació y creció bajo el seno de una familia campesina y ganadera.
Doña Reyna quiso además de este oficio aprender otra profesión y salir adelante por lo cual estudió la carrera para maestra de primaria y actualmente imparte clases en una escuelita aledaña a su comunidad. Tiene más de veinte años de dedicarse al oficio de la Ganadería donde gracias a su esfuerzo y la ayuda de los préstamos que le ha financiado Kiva a través de Ceprodel ha incrementado su inventario ganadero donde hoy tiene más vacas paridas por lo cual le beneficia por la comercialización de leche.
Doña Reyna necesita un crédito para la compra de cuatro terneros.
Espera y confía en Dios que le sigan apoyando para seguir  mejorando sus condiciones de vida y para en un futuro dejarle un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel is a 41 year old woman who lives in the Los Limones village in the municipality of El Sauce, where she was born and raised under the wing of a farming and livestock raising family. In addition to this trade, Mrs. Reyna wanted to learn another profession to get ahead. Therefore, she studied to be a school teacher. She is currently teaching in a small school adjacent to her community. She has over twenty years in the livestock trade, whereby today, thanks to her efforts and to the help of loans financed by Kiva through Ceprodel, she has increased her livestock inventory by having more recently calved cows, which benefits her in the commercialization of milk. Mrs. Reyna needs a loan to buy four calves. She hopes and trusts in God that she will continue to get your support to improve her quality of life and, in the future, to be able to leave a good patrimony to her kids.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandals from Masaya.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 55-year-old married mother of 7 children from Ormoc, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. 

Susana has been running her business for more than 2 years now. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more inventory to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, etc. 

A loan will help Susana improve her inventory and thus attract more buyers to her store. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Tránsito

texts.es:
Consuelo de 50 años de edad, es viuda, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la situación económica de sus padres, tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y han formado sus propios hogares.

Consuelo tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas, panes, bebidas, ella hace todos los preparativos para elaborar los productos, ya tiene un año en esta actividad pues logró conseguir un puesto en el mercado, anteriormente solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos pero su esposo falleció y ella tuvo que tomar las riendas del hogar, el lugar donde trabaja está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y se va a pie, el horario de trabajo es de 5 AM a 2 PM y nadie mas se involucra en la actividad.

El crédito lo necesita para terminar de cancelar el local donde vende, pues cuando los construyó tuvo que endeudarse para poder tener el puesto.

Sus sueños son aumentar las ventas, tener mejores ingresos y cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Consuelo, age 50, is a widow.  She didn’t have the chance to go to school due to her parents’ economic situation.  She has three grown-up children, and they have formed their own homes.

Consuelo has a business selling pupusas, bread, and drinks.  She makes all the preparations to make the products.  She has already been doing this business for a year, and she managed to secure a stand in the market.  Before, she only worked doing household tasks, but her husband passed away, and she had to take the reins of the home.  The place where she works is one kilometer away from her house, and she goes on foot.  Her work schedule is 5 a.m. to 2 p.m., and nobody else is involved in this business.

She needs the loan to finish paying off the venue where she sells, because when she built it she had to go into debt to be able to have the stand.

Her dreams are to increase her sales, have better income, and cover her necessities.

loans.use: to finish paying off the venue where she sells, since when she built it she had to go into debt to be able to have the stand.

loans.name: Camila Andrea

texts.es:
Comprar una maquina recubridora y una máquina de coser son los insumos que necesita Camila una maravillosa joven de 19 años que junto con su mama formaran una actividad económica la cual es la confección a terceros.
Esto lo hace pensando en tener una actividad para alimentarse, para estudiar, para mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, para hacer algo y sabe que con el apoyo y enseñanzas de su madre llegara lejos. 
Por eso para ella es tan importante tu apoyo, porque una donación será un paso más para iniciar un negocio que representara el 100% del sustento de ella y de su madre de no lograrlo no sabrá que les deparara el futuro por eso pone todas sus esperanzas este crédito ayudala!
texts.en:
Camila is a marvelous young woman who is 19 years old. Together with her mother they will start a business sewing clothing for third parties. In order to do this they need to buy a coverstitch and a regular sewing machine. They are doing this to have a way to feed themselves, to pay for school, to improve the condition of their house and to have something to do. She knows that with the support and teaching of her mother, she will go far.

Your support is very important to her because one donation will bring them one step closer towards starting a business that will support them 100%. If they do not achieve this, they do not know what the future will hold in store so they are placing all their hope in receiving this loan.  Give her a hand!

loans.use: to buy a coverstich and a regular sewing machine to start a dressmaking business with her mother.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita, 38, is a married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Elenita is engaged in hog-raising business. She also earns additional income through her sari-sari or retail store business.

Elenita is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. She will also buy stock for the store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries. This loan will help Elenita improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

She dreams of improving her livelihood in the future. Moreover, she also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed, and to buy stock for the store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 56-year-old hardworking mother of 3 children. She has been providing sewing and tailoring services in her community where she is quite popular for her sewing skills. 

Zarina’s work managed to bring the family out of a financial crisis. Over the years, she has been able to establish a good clientele. 

Zarina has requested a 45,000 PKR loan which she intends to use to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of thread and lace in order to consistently meet her customers' demands. 

Zarina aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of thread and lace to consistently  meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medications, to pay for medical consultations, and to purchase flight tickets.

loans.name: Ayisa

texts.en: Ayisa is married with one child who attends school. She has had a beauty salon business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, rollers, braids and hair treatments. She gets additional income from selling used clothes. She works in a rented shop and works six days a week. Her major business challenge is 'on and off' electricity. She aspires to own a bridal salon. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and other items

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ormoc, Leyte. She earns a living through selling buko drink to the people in her place. Buko drink is a combination of young coconut and milk. This has been her income for the past five years now. Teresita is asking to take a loan to buy more buko, milk and sugar for her business. She believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more buko, milk and sugar

loans.name: Eronides

texts.es:
Eronides tiene 66 años de edad, vive con su familia que está formada por su eposa y sus dos hijos, él se crió con sus padres quiénes se dedicaban a la agricultura y ganadería.

Eronides tiene una experiencia de 29 años en realizar actividades de agricultura y ganadería, además tiene un año de dedicarse al comercio, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos pero también le ayuda a atender la tienda.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar gaseosas, jabones, condimentos, cebollas, etc para surtir su tienda, también comprará concentrado para las vacas.

Sus proyecciones para un futuro son apoyar a sus hijos en educación y pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Eronides is 66 years old and lives with his family, which is made up by his wife and his two children. He was raised by his parents, who made a living from agriculture and cattle-raising. Eronides has 29 years of experience working in agriculture and cattle-raising and now he also has a year of working in retail. His wife is a homemaker, but also helps tend their store.

The loan he is requesting is to purchase soft drinks, soap, spices, onions, etc. to stock up their store. He will also be purchasing feed for his cattle. His projection for the future is to support his children’s education and pay off this loan.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks, soap, spices, onions, etc. to stock up their store, as well as feed for his cattle

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 22-year-old, married, vigorous lady. 

Sajida has been manufacturing carpets for many years in order to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community, and she's able to make enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business Sajida contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR so she can buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fabric to increase her sales. 

Sajida hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fabric to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is 40 years old and married. She is a mother of three children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She is working hard to bear her household expenditures. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more livestock for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to resell in the market.

loans.name: Damaris Saraí

texts.es:
Damaris de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive en casa con sus padres y hermanos.

Damaris tiene un comedor, lo administra desde hace un año, su madre le enseñó a cocinar y por eso el negocio es fruto de su aprendizaje, ella tien dos empleados que le ayudan a atender el comedor, Damaris recorre 1 kilómetro para llegar al local y trabaja de 5:30 AM a 5:00 PM.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar leña, maíz y todos los demás insumos que necesita para elaborar los alimentos que vende. El crédito será de mucha ayuda pues podrá cubrir las necesidades en su negocio.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando, ampliar el local y aseguir aportando al hogar.
texts.en:
Damaris, age 27, studied up through ninth grade.  She is single and has no children.  She lives at home with her parents and siblings.

Damaris has a small restaurant.  She has run it for a year.  Her mother taught her how to cook, and therefore the business is the fruit of her learning.  She has two employees who help her look after the restaurant.  Damaris travels one kilometer to arrive at the venue, and she works from 5:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy firewood, corn, and all the other supplies that she needs to prepare the food she sells.  The loan will be a great help because it will be able to cover the necessities of her business.

Her dream is to keep working, expand her venue, and continue contributing to the home.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and all the other supplies she needs to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new grinding mill to install in a nearby town that lacks one.

loans.name: Musarit

texts.en: Musarit is 40 years old and she is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Yasmeen Bibi

texts.en:
Yasmeen Bibi is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothing for the past 8 years. He is the sole provider responsible for feeding his entire family and managing the household. 

Yasmeen Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of clothing in bulk to resell, but, due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, Yasmeen Bibi is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With help from this loan Yasmeen Bibi will be able to assist her husband with the bulk clothing purchase. He will also be able to increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit. 

Yasmeen Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to the market

loans.name: Afsheen Kanwal

texts.en:
Afsheen Kanwal is a 31 year old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband, who fulfills the needs of the entire family, has been running a general store for past ten years. 

Afsheen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities (e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items) for his business. However, due to financial constraints, he is not able to buy all of the aforementioned products to resell. Therefore, Afsheen has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy the items, which will help him earn the most income possible and allow him to effectively manage his household and business.

Afsheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase items for her husband's store

loans.name: Kanysh

texts.ru: Каныш, 55 лет, замужем. У Каныш средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она работает медсестрой, получая заработную плату в размере более 13,300 сом (KGS). Каныш запланировала в этом году отремонтировать дом, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на ремонт дома. Доходы от заработной платы Каныш будет вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий и хочет накопить на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Kanysh is 55 years old and married.  She has a specialized-secondary education and she works as a nurse, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She makes slightly more than 13,300 som (KGS) per month.  This year, she is planning to renovate her house and, for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC  and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to perform some repairs in her house.  Kanysh will use her earnings to further improve her living conditions.  She would also like to save enough money to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to perform some repairs and renovations in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods for retail sale in order to increase her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Mirriam's Group

texts.en:
Mirriam is 26 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Mirriam has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mirriam also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Mirriam's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her grain mill

loans.name: Aksana

texts.ru: Аксана, 30 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Аксаны- средне-специальное образование, у нее большой опыт в сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сейчас в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 13 овец. Ежемесячный доход Аксаны от бизнеса около 15,000 сом (KGS). Аксана решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Аксана планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что поможет ей улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Aksana is 30 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a specialized-secondary education and a great deal of experience in farming.  She currently has three cows and 13 sheep on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  Aksana has decided to turn to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and to request a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase ten sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her farming business, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Gulsunai

texts.ru: Гулсунай 21 год, замужем, детей нет. У нее среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством, супруг активно помогает. У Гулсунай есть 3 коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсунай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), полученные средства она направит на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита помогут Гулсунай в будущем развить ее бизнес и приобрести мебель для дома.
texts.en: Gulsunai is 21 years old and married, but she doesn't have any children yet.  She has a secondary education and works in agriculture.  Her husband actively helps her.  Gulsunai currently has three cows and 20 sheep on her farm, and she makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy more livestock for breeding.  The earnings from her loan will help her to develop her business in the long term and also to buy some furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Aslankul

texts.ru: Асланкул, 38 лет, женат, есть 3 детей. У него среднее образование, с 2007 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Асланкула на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, на ежедневной основе он реализует молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль Асланкула составляет 16,000 сом (KGS), в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Асланкула, а также накопить средства на утепление дома.
texts.en: Aslankul is 38 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 2007.  He currently has two cows and he sells milk every day.  He makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop his farming business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale.  The earnings from his business will allow him to improve his living conditions and will also help him to save enough money to heat his house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Гулзат средне-специальное образование. С 2000 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 15 овец, 11 коз. На земельном наделе она выращивает ячмень и клевер. Гулзат получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также хочет накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Gulzat is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a specialized-secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 2000.  This activity constitutes an additional source of income for her family.  She currently has two cows, 15 sheep and 11 goats on her farm.  She also grows barley and clover on a plot of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a few steers.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business.  She would also like to save enough money to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy some steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, age 57, resident of Coron Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Dioscoro, a carpenter and also a farmer, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Helen dreams of growing and expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy the additional grocery items, beverages and toiletries she needs to expand her store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. She takes care of additional family members and she gets additional income from selling piped water. Joyce works six days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 700,000  from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy land to start growing green bananas. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Delmi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delmi de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta 6to grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor en pequeño, tiene 4 hijos pero ninguno vive con ellos ya que han formado sus propios hogares, en casa de Delmi vive una nieta.

Delmi es ama de casa, además le ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas y a cuidar el ganado, el lugar donde siembra con su esposo stá a 10 minutos de su casa.

Ella necesita el crédito para pagar mano de obra ya que necesita picar un zacate y otra parte lo usará para comprar novillas.

Su sueño es seguir ayudándole a su esposo a trabajar, y espera que le vaya muy bien en la siempre que está próxima.
texts.en:
Delmi, who is 47 years old, went to school through 6th grade. She is married, and her husband is a small farmer. She has four children, but none of them live with them since they have formed their own households. A granddaughter lives in Delmi's house.

Delmi is a housewife. In addition, she helps her husband in the agricultural work and in caring for the livestock. The place where she and her husband plant crops is 10 minutes from their house.

She needs the loan to pay for labor, since she needs to cut fodder, and she will use another part to buy heifers.

Her dream is to continue helping her husband work, and she hopes that it will go well for them in the coming planting season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, since she needs to cut fodder, and to buy heifers

loans.name: Philomena's Group

texts.en:
Philomena is 61 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Philomena has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Philomena also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Philomena's Group will be able to receive a total of 15 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta, a 46-year-old married lady with no children. She is standing in the cold in front of her house where she wants to build a fence with your loan. 

For the past 10 years, she’s been pursuing agriculture/livestock. In the 2,700 square meters of agricultural land she owns, she has planted grapevines and sells homemade wine and an alcoholic drink called locally ‘raki’ and also plants seasonal veggies. She’s also got a dairy cow and sells about 13 liter/day raw milk and a calf/year and has five beehives and sells raw honey.  Violeta’s husband is passionate about the beehive activity and he wants to expand this. Where they have the beehives, they can be fed with chestnut/heather and arbutus unedo or strawberry trees or cane apple, native to Western Europe and the Mediterranean basin. From the latest, people here in Albania even make an alcoholic drink called ‘raki mare’.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house and yard.

loans.name: Cathreen

texts.en: Cathreen is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of 5 children. Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Cathreen has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her son. He will utilize this amount to buy new tires, spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Her son is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for him and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, spare parts and tools for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en: Pathani is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of 1 child (who is also shown in the photo). Her husband (also shown in the photo) started a rickshaw driving business some time ago. He owns one rickshaw and needs some financial help to pay for repairs and maintenance costs. Therefore, Pathani has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is thankful for previous loans. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance costs of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Jacob, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. He is 65 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 9 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.  He is married and has 4 children.

Jacob is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Jacob says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Jacob will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is a 30-year-old married woman; she has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them in the market. She also sells their milk to generate extra income. Shakeela has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow in order to increase her business. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 39-year-old married mother of two children who opened in 2000 her own gadgets, gifts and special occasions store to support her husband in increasing their family's income and covering their children's school tuition fees.

This is Hanan's ninth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; through her previous loans, she increased her business capital in a well-managed way. Her currently acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special Mother's Day gifts and gadgets with encouraging affordable prices.

She is working hard to develop her shop properly and will try to make the necessary decoration to display her merchandise in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Mother's Day gifts and gadgets with encouraging affordable prices

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn, 27, is a married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her buko selling business. Buko, a local name for young coconut fruit is valued as one of the ingredients in making desserts and in some cooking. Jenelyn has been in the business for more than 5 years now. Jenelyn is asking for a loan to buy more buko to sell in the market. In the future, Jenelyn hopes of improving her livelihood. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more buko

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles is a fish vendor from Ormoc, Leyte. She is 54 years old, married and has seven children. Angeles has been in the fish vending business for more than 7 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell and a new weighing scale and bucket for storage. A loan will help Angeles in improving her business thus augmenting her income and profit. Angeles dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and a new weighing scale and bucket for storage

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is a fish vendor from Leyte, Philippines. The 30-year-old mother of two has been in the fish-vending business for more than four years now. 

Iris is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell to the market. A loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Iris dreams of making her fish-vending business a successful and profitable one.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to the market

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 35-year-old sari-sari (variety) store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has five children. Josephine has been in the business for more than five years now. She also earns an additional income through hog raising. 

Josephine is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business and her income. 

Josephine has hopes of making her livelihood more sustainable and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments and animal feed

loans.name: Asmati

texts.en:
Asmati is a 46-year-old single woman from the village of Tskhratskaro. She lives with her pensioner mother and 2 brothers. Asmati and her brothers have their own small agribusiness and get income from selling agricultural products at the local market. However, basically they have seasonal income which is hardly enough to meet the basic needs. Asmati decided to start her own, more stable activity and requested a loan as she has no financial support.
